data.name: About
data.value: About {0}

data.name: AboutAxcryptHeading1
data.value: Our story

data.name: AboutAxcryptHeading1Text1
data.value: Founded in 2001, AxCrypt set out to make encryption simple for everyone. Frustrated by the lack of easy-to-use security tools, we developed AxCrypt, which quickly became a global favorite with over 20 million downloads.

data.name: AboutAxcryptHeading1Text2
data.value: In 2014, we took AxCrypt to the next level by forming AxCrypt AB. Today, AxCrypt is recognized as one of the world’s leading encryption solutions, serving users across Europe, America, and beyond.

data.name: AboutAxcryptHeading1Text3
data.value: Our mission is to provide individuals and small teams with secure, user-friendly encryption. We’re excited to continue making data protection accessible and reliable for everyone.

data.name: AboutAxcryptHeading1Text5
data.value: sites recommendations

data.name: AboutAxcryptHeading2Text1
data.value: Security

data.name: AboutAxcryptHeading2Text2
data.value: Reliability

data.name: AboutAxcryptHeading2Text3
data.value: Simplicity

data.name: AboutAxcryptHeading2Text4
data.value: Security drives everything we do at AxCrypt. Your encrypted files are accessible only to you, provided you maintain control of your password. Beyond delivering top-tier encryption, we are dedicated to raising awareness about the critical need for encryption and advocating for best practices in safeguarding data.

data.name: AboutAxcryptHeading2Text5
data.value: AxCrypt has been a trusted encryption solution for over two decades. Our use of advanced AES-256 encryption ensures that your files are protected with one of the most secure technologies available. Millions of users trust us to deliver consistent, dependable protection for their most sensitive data.

data.name: AboutAxcryptHeading2Text6
data.value: Security should be simple, and with AxCrypt, it is. We believe encryption should be easy for everyone, which is why we've designed intuitive features like one-password encryption and automated file protection. Our solution provides the security you need, without the complexity you don’t.

data.name: AboutAxcryptHeading3
data.value: Our history

data.name: AboutAxcryptHeading4
data.value: Our culture

data.name: AboutAxcryptHeading4Text1
data.value: At AxCrypt, our culture is rooted in collaboration, innovation, and a shared commitment to excellence. We believe that a thriving work environment encourages creativity and professional development. Ease of working is fundamental to our organization, allowing us to focus on what matters most. We celebrate small wins and recognize the hard work of our team members as we strive toward our goals. Our team members are empowered to explore new ideas, take initiative, and work together to bring out exceptional encryption solutions that make a real difference in our users' lives.

data.name: AboutAxcryptHeading4Text2
data.value: If you're a passionate cybersecurity professional seeking a fulfilling and challenging career, come join us at AxCrypt and be a part of the change

data.name: AboutAxcryptHeading4Text3
data.value: Explore careers

data.name: AboutAxcryptHeading5
data.value: Represented countries

data.name: AboutAxcryptHeading6
data.value: Awards and rankings

data.name: AboutAxcryptHeading7
data.value: Our management team

data.name: AboutAxcryptHeading8
data.value: Our office locations

data.name: AboutAxcryptHeading9
data.value: Press centre

data.name: AboutAxcryptHeading9Text1
data.value: AxCrypt is focused on providing simple, secure encryption to protect your files. We strive to keep you informed on best practices for file protection and ensure that managing your files is safe and hassle-free. We continuously adapt to emerging technologies to provide you with top-tier protection. Find more updates in our Press Centre

data.name: AboutAxcryptHistoryText1
data.value: The history of AxCrypt started in 2001 when initial author Svante needed to share confidential data over the Internet and failed to find existing data security solutions for Internet services that were both simple and easy to use for everyone. It was then that he developed and released the first version of AxCrypt.

data.name: AboutAxcryptHistoryText2
data.value: In 2014, after 13 years on the market, AxCrypt had grown to be one of the world’s most popular encryption applications with over 20 million downloads worldwide. Svante teamed up with serial entrepreneur Zebastian Victorin to commercialize the product and founded AxCrypt AB to take AxCrypt to the next level.

data.name: AboutAxcryptHistoryText3
data.value: After 2 years of hard work AxCrypt 2 was released in 2016.

data.name: AboutAxcryptHistoryText4
data.value: Since then we have been awarded “The World’s Best Encryption Software” by the prestigious PC Magazine 2016-2024 as well as many other review sites in the world. We have a global reach with users from all countries. Our biggest markets are Europe with 45% and America with 30% of the users.

data.name: AboutAxcryptHistoryText5
data.value: Our mission is to provide individuals and small teams with encryption solutions that are easier to use than ever before. We’re removing the complexity from the use of strong and proven cryptographic technology.

data.name: AboutAxcryptHistoryText6
data.value: We are a highly motivated, creative and powerful team that is passionate about making data security solutions simple and reliable for individuals and teams.

data.name: AboutAxcryptLinkLabel
data.value: About AxCrypt

data.name: AboutAxcryptMainHeading
data.value: Globally Rewarded & Easy-to-Use File Encryption - Trusted by Millions Worldwide

data.name: AboutAxcryptVisionReliabilityText
data.value: AxCrypt has been on the market for 15 years, and has grown to become one of the world’s most popular encryption applications with more than 20 million downloads. Over the years we have also been mentioned and rated by many as one of the world’s best encryption applications.

data.name: AboutAxcryptVisionSecurityText
data.value: Security is crucial to us. Everything we do with AxCrypt is done with security as the highest priority. We make sure that no one ever gets access to your encrypted files, as long as you have control of your own password.

data.name: AboutAxcryptVisionSimplicityText
data.value: Encryption is complicated, but this has not prevented us from constantly working to simplify it for the user. We have developed unique features that make the use of strong encryption and the sharing of encryption keys more simple and secure than any other software.

data.name: AboutPartnerSting
data.value: STING helps talented people to turn their ideas into sustainable businesses.

data.name: AboutUsHistoryText1
data.value: AxCrypt is developed and released, offering a simple and user-friendly solution for sharing confidential data online.

data.name: AboutUsHistoryText10
data.value: Introduced Password Manager Mobile Version and Share Passwords feature, allowing secure password sharing through encryption.

data.name: AboutUsHistoryText11
data.value: With the launch of Group Sharing and Management for secure file sharing, AxCrypt strengthens access control and solidifies its position as the world’s top encryption software, winning the PCMag Editors' Choice award.

data.name: AboutUsHistoryText2
data.value: With over 20 million downloads, AxCrypt is commercialized, leading to the formation of AxCrypt AB.

data.name: AboutUsHistoryText3
data.value: The release of AxCrypt 2 marked a major milestone, delivering a modernized UI and advanced features like the Key Sharing capability. We also released AxCrypt for Windows, earning the PCMag Editors' Choice award and gaining widespread recognition from top review sites.

data.name: AboutUsHistoryText4
data.value: Established a global presence in Europe and America with multi-language support, AxCrypt enhanced its capabilities by launching a mobile app and setting up an Offshore Development Center.

data.name: AboutUsHistoryText5
data.value: AxCrypt improved offline data access and enhanced local file monitoring, enabling users to access encrypted files without an internet connection and safeguard files on their devices. Additionally, AxCrypt expanded its platform support by launching dedicated apps for Mac and mobile users.

data.name: AboutUsHistoryText6
data.value: AxCrypt introduced the Business tier package, offering solutions designed to meet the specific needs of organizations.

data.name: AboutUsHistoryText7
data.value: AxCrypt introduced the Master Key feature for Business subscriptions and launched its Reseller and Affiliate Program to broaden its reach.

data.name: AboutUsHistoryText8
data.value: AxCrypt upgraded the mobile app to support file encryption and decryption, along with encryption for major cloud drives on Android and iOS, further enhancing mobile security.

data.name: AboutUsHistoryText9
data.value: AxCrypt added cloud service support for seamless encryption across major platforms, trusted by over 1000+ organizations and cloud service providers.

data.name: AxCBTGDBlock1Text1
data.value: AxCrypt now offers a modern interface and improved performance across platforms. The new design offers a more intuitive experience and a simplified encryption workflow, making it easier than ever to secure your files. This guide walks you through how to use AxCrypt efficiently and take full advantage of its interface and features.

data.name: AxCBTGDBlock1Text2
data.value: You can begin with a 30-day free trial by selecting either the Premium or Business plan. During the trial period, you'll have full access to all features included in the plan you choose.

data.name: AxCBTGDHeroText
data.value: AxCrypt's new MAUI design

data.name: AxCKSGDBlock1Heading
data.value: What is Key Sharing?

data.name: AxCKSGDBlock1Text1
data.value: Typically, employees share relevant and work-related information with each other. However, worrying about the data’s security during the sharing process is inevitable. Since this raises concern about sharing secured files, it is incredibly vital for encryption software to have a feature that lets you share and receive files more securely.

data.name: AxCKSGDBlock1Text2
data.value: With the key sharing feature, you can share files without the need to share passwords. Instead, you can share file keys to specific colleagues to give them access to particular files. Then, they can easily browse or edit the shared file. Even more so, it should allow you to unshare the file to remove the person’s access quickly.

data.name: AxCKSGDBlock1Text3
data.value: Key Sharing is an AxCrypt’s Award-Winning file access sharing feature which is super easy to use, and is designed to maximize file security and privacy.

data.name: AxCKSGDBlock2Heading
data.value: Why AxCrypt Key Sharing ?

data.name: AxCKSGDBlock2Text1
data.value: AxCrypt's key sharing allows you to keep your files secured while also sharing it with your colleagues. It enables you to collaborate and connect with other members without jeopardising the confidentiality of your data.

data.name: AxCKSGDBlock2Text2
data.value: Using the key sharing feature, you can give file access to anyone and withdraw it whenever you want; you don't even have to disclose your own password. With their own password, the other user can access the shared files.

data.name: AxCKSGDBlock2Text3
data.value: Key Sharing is built on Zero-Knowledge Encryption, which means that the process of file encryption and decryption occurs on your computer or smartphone. AxCrypt doesn’t know your account password or your files, making AxCrypt have 'Zero-Knowledge' of your data.

data.name: AxCKSGDBlock2Text4
data.value: The Key Sharing feature is designed to prioritize security and privacy of your files. The files are still encrypted with the strong AES-256 bit algorithm when you share it, and the recipients can easily access them at their convenience.

data.name: AxCKSGDBlock2Text5
data.value: Imagine sharing a highly sensitive business document such as a revenue report with your boss or colleague – while ensuring that file is encrypted, even after the recipient opens it, that’s the Key Sharing feature for you.

data.name: AxCKSGDBlock3Heading
data.value: How Does Key Sharing Work?

data.name: AxCKSGDBlock3Text1
data.value: AxCrypt uses Asymmetrical encryption to securely share the encrypted files. That means public key is used for encryption and private key is used for decryption. AxCrypt generates an RSA-4096 public and private key pair when an account is created. The private key is encrypted with your password.

data.name: AxCKSGDBlock3Text2
data.value: The unique thing about public sharing and private secret key pairs is that while anyone can *encrypt* data with the public sharing key, only the person knowing the private secret key can *decrypt*, and even knowing the public sharing key it’s not possible to figure out the private secret key.

data.name: AxCKSGDBlock3Text3
data.value: When we encrypt a file, we don’t encrypt it with your password as the encryption key. We encrypt your file with a random and unique key every time a file is encrypted. We call this the master file key or session key. It’s this master file key that we encrypt with your password and add to the encrypted file.

data.name: AxCKSGDBlock3Text4
data.value: We also encrypt this same master file key with your public sharing key from your AxCrypt ID, as well as the public sharing keys of any additional recipients you may have added with the key sharing feature.

data.name: AxCKSGDBlock3Text5
data.value: Once recipients receive a key shared encrypted file, the following operations are performed to decrypt the data,

data.name: AxCKSGDBlock3Text5P1
data.value: AxCrypt uses the recipient’s private key to decrypt the session key which was encrypted with recipient’s public key.

data.name: AxCKSGDBlock3Text5P2
data.value: Upon successful decryption, the session key is used to decrypt the shared file.

data.name: AxCKSGDBlock3Text6
data.value: Note: The private keys of all users are encrypted with the user’s account password, which are never stored on our servers or even on your computer.

data.name: AxCKSGDBlock4Heading
data.value: How to Key Share Files with Your Colleagues and Friends?

data.name: AxCKSGDBlock4SH1P1
data.value: Click on the Share Keys action button on the home screen

data.name: AxCKSGDBlock4SH1P2
data.value: Select the encrypted file(s) from the file selection window

data.name: AxCKSGDBlock4SH1P3
data.value: In the Share Access popup window, provide the recipient’s email address you want to share the file with and click the Add button

data.name: AxCKSGDBlock4SH1P4
data.value: Verify the details and click the Apply button

data.name: AxCKSGDBlock4SH1Text1
data.value: You can download the AxCrypt app from our website.

data.name: AxCKSGDBlock4SH1Text2
data.value: You can also key share the file(s) by selecting from the Recent Files tab or folder(s) by selecting from the Secured Folders tab and clicking the “Share Keys” action button. Then follow the above steps. Enable Include sub folder option if you also wish to key share the secured folders sub folder(s) files.

data.name: AxCKSGDBlock4SH2P1
data.value: Tap on the Share Keys icon from the home screen

data.name: AxCKSGDBlock4SH2P2
data.value: Go to the desired file source

data.name: AxCKSGDBlock4SH2P3
data.value: Complete the authorization with the selected cloud provider. Ignore if the step is already completed or not applicable.

data.name: AxCKSGDBlock4SH2P4
data.value: Select the file(s) from the file selection page

data.name: AxCKSGDBlock4SH2P5
data.value: In the Key Share page, provide the recipient’s email address you want to share the file with and click the plus button.

data.name: AxCKSGDBlock4SH2P6
data.value: Verify the details and Tap the Apply button

data.name: AxCKSGDBlock4SH2Text1
data.value: You can download or Update the AxCrypt app from Play Store or App Store.

data.name: AxCKSGDBlock4SH3P1
data.value: We need to send the physical file(s) with the recipients, AxCrypt never sends the physical file.

data.name: AxCKSGDBlock4SH3P2
data.value: The person you’re sending the file to must use AxCrypt with the email address you shared the file with.

data.name: AxCKSGDBlock4SH3P3
data.value: The recipient just needs a free AxCrypt ID and will be automatically invited via email if necessary.

data.name: AxCKSGDBlock4SubHeading1
data.value: Key Sharing on Desktop

data.name: AxCKSGDBlock4SubHeading2
data.value: Key Sharing on Mobile

data.name: AxCKSGDBlock4SubHeading3
data.value: Notes

data.name: AxCKSGDBlock4Text1
data.value: You can Key Share your encrypted files with AxCrypt’s Premium and Business subscription plans. Check out our pricing page to choose the best plan for you.

data.name: AxCPMGDBlock1Heading
data.value: Why AxCrypt’s Password Manager?

data.name: AxCPMGDBlock1Text1
data.value: AxCrypt’s Password Manager is a powerful and easy-to-use tool for securely managing and sharing your passwords, card details, and notes wherever you are.

data.name: AxCPMGDBlock1Text2
data.value: AxCrypt secures your data using the strongest encryption algorithm, AES-256, with Zero-Knowledge Encryption. This means that access to your data solely resides with you and no one else, not even AxCrypt.

data.name: AxCPMGDBlock1Text3
data.value: The Password Manager can be accessed from any web browser or using AxCrypt’s mobile apps on Android & iOS. When data is synchronized to your devices, the data remains encrypted using 256-bit symmetric encryption. Data in-transit is also encrypted with Transport Layer Security (TLS).

data.name: AxCPMGDBlock1Text4
data.value: Also, AxCrypt's Password Manager comes equipped with a free Password Generator tool which can generate 'n' number of strong passwords that are not nonsensical and are possible to remember and type.

data.name: AxCPMGDBlock2_SH1_Text1
data.value: AxCrypt has zero knowledge of your private keys or password. It means that you – and only you – can decrypt your stored data.

data.name: AxCPMGDBlock2_SH1_Text5
data.value: Generate and save unlimited number of passwords, cards, and notes effortlessly, ensuring all your sensitive information is securely organized.

data.name: AxCPMGDBlock2_SH2_Text2
data.value: AxCrypt uses the Advanced Encryption Standard with 256-bit keys for the data encryption.

data.name: AxCPMGDBlock2_SH3_Text3
data.value: AxCrypt uses the Asymmetric encryption, enabling you to share your private data with friends, family, and colleagues without disclosing the password.

data.name: AxCPMGDBlock2_SH4_Text4
data.value: AxCrypt’s data centres are located in EU, adhering to the stricter GDPR data laws and NIS2 guidelines.

data.name: AxCPMGDBlock2Heading
data.value: AxCrypt’s Top Notch Security in a View

data.name: AxCPMGDBlock2SubHeading1
data.value: Zero-Knowledge Encryption

data.name: AxCPMGDBlock2SubHeading2
data.value: AES-256 bit Algorithm

data.name: AxCPMGDBlock2SubHeading3
data.value: Secured Share

data.name: AxCPMGDBlock2SubHeading4
data.value: Secure and Private Servers

data.name: AxCPMGDBlock3B1
data.value: The personal data is encrypted using AES and a random 256-bit session key is generated for each time.

data.name: AxCPMGDBlock3B2
data.value: The session key is encrypted with your password, using a special key wrap algorithm, with AES at the core. This encrypted session key is added to the encrypted data.

data.name: AxCPMGDBlock3B3
data.value: Take your password, decrypt the session key encrypted with a password above, and try to decrypt it. The decrypted session key is used to decrypt the data.

data.name: AxCPMGDBlock3Heading
data.value: How Do We Secure Your Data?

data.name: AxCPMGDBlock3Text1
data.value: AxCrypt use your account password to encrypt your passwords, card details, and notes, which is never stored on your computer or our servers. This means that only you can access your information.

data.name: AxCPMGDBlock3Text2
data.value: AxCrypt uses the Advanced Encryption Standard with 256-bit keys in Counter mode with a ‘random’ IV for the data encryption.

data.name: AxCPMGDBlock3Text3
data.value: Key wrapping of the password is done using the NIST specification for AES Key Wrap. The key derived from the password with PBKDF2-SHA512 is only used as a key encrypting key.

data.name: AxCPMGDBlock3Text4
data.value: When you encrypt your data, AxCrypt uses AES-256 symmetrical strong encrypting algorithm, with a single key used for both encryption and decryption.

data.name: AxCPMGDBlock3Text5
data.value: In principle, the process in which AxCrypt encrypts data is as follows

data.name: AxCPMGDBlock3Text6
data.value: To decrypt a file, AxCrypt in principle does the following

data.name: AxCPMGDBlock4Heading
data.value: What Happens When You Securely Share Details?

data.name: AxCPMGDBlock4Text1
data.value: AxCrypt’s Password Manager has a secure sharing feature letting you share your passwords, card details, and notes by adding recipients email address, who can access it on their Password Manager. The recipient just needs a free AxCrypt ID and will be automatically invited via email if necessary.

data.name: AxCPMGDBlock4Text2
data.value: Also, you can set visibility options (once, one day, forever, and so on) while sharing the private data.

data.name: AxCPMGDBlock4Text3
data.value: AxCrypt uses Asymmetrical encryption to securely share the encrypted data.

data.name: AxCPMGDBlock4Text4
data.value: When secure sharing, the session key is encrypted using RSA-4096 with the public key of other recipients you’ve chosen to key share the data with. This encrypted session key is added to the encrypted data.

data.name: AxCPMGDBlock4Text5
data.value: When recipient access the shared data, AxCrypt will take the recipient's private key, to decrypt the session key which was encrypted with the public key. The decrypted session key is then used to decrypt the shared data.

data.name: AxCPMGDBlock4Text6
data.value: Note: Your private key is encrypted with your account password. AxCrypt never stores your account password on our servers or your computers.

data.name: AxCPMGDBlock5Heading
data.value: How to Use AxCrypt’s Password Manager?

data.name: AxCPMGDBlock5Text1
data.value: The Password Manager is included in AxCrypt’s Password Manager, Premium, and Business subscription plans. AxCrypt’s Free/Viewer users can access and share passwords, card details, and notes with certain limitations.

data.name: AxCPMGDBlock5Text2
data.value: Set up a Password Manager subscription

data.name: AxCPMGDBlock5Text2P1
data.value: Visit the Pricing Page and select the plan of your choice.

data.name: AxCPMGDBlock5Text2P2
data.value: Complete the sign-in (if already registered) or sign up with your email address using a strong password.

data.name: AxCPMGDBlock5Text2P3
data.value: Choose the yearly/monthly subscription type and complete the payment.

data.name: AxCPMGDBlock5Text2P4
data.value: Click continue to navigate to the password manager

data.name: AxCPMGDBlock5Text3
data.value: Create passwords, cards, and notes

data.name: AxCPMGDBlock5Text3P1
data.value: Click the button to select the type – Password, Card or Note

data.name: AxCPMGDBlock5Text3P2
data.value: For Password type

data.name: AxCPMGDBlock5Text3P2S1
data.value: Enter the URL of the website, description, and username.

data.name: AxCPMGDBlock5Text3P2S2
data.value: Generate a strong password by clicking the Suggest password button or enter an existing password.

data.name: AxCPMGDBlock5Text3P3
data.value: For Card type

data.name: AxCPMGDBlock5Text3P3S1
data.value: Enter the card number, name, description, expiry date, and security code(cvv)

data.name: AxCPMGDBlock5Text3P4
data.value: For Note type

data.name: AxCPMGDBlock5Text3P4S1
data.value: Enter the description and private note

data.name: AxCPMGDBlock5Text3P5
data.value: Click the Save button

data.name: AxCPMGDBlock5Text4
data.value: Manage passwords, cards, and notes

data.name: AxCPMGDBlock5Text4P1
data.value: View – Click any of the password item from the password manager.

data.name: AxCPMGDBlock5Text4P1S1
data.value: Click the masked field (*******) to view the secret data

data.name: AxCPMGDBlock5Text4P1S2
data.value: Click outside to mask the secret data.

data.name: AxCPMGDBlock5Text4P2
data.value: Copy - Click the CopyToClipboard icon to copy the password/secret data without seeing.

data.name: AxCPMGDBlock5Text4P3
data.value: Edit – Click the Edit button to update the secured information.

data.name: AxCPMGDBlock5Text4P4
data.value: Delete – Click the Delete button to delete the secured information from password manager.

data.name: AxCPMGDBlock5Text5
data.value: Share passwords, cards, and notes

data.name: AxCPMGDBlock5Text5P1
data.value: AxCrypt’s Password Manager has a secure sharing feature that allows you to share your secured passwords, cards and notes with others.

data.name: AxCPMGDBlock5Text5P2
data.value: You can share your secret data with multiple recipient emails specifying the visibility options (once, one day, forever, and so on) individually.

data.name: AxCPMGDBlock5Text5P3
data.value: With the Password Manager and Premium subscription plan, you can share with up to 10 email addresses at once.

data.name: AxCPMGDBlock5Text5P4
data.value: With a Business subscription plan, you can share with up to 20 email addresses at once.

data.name: AxCPMGDBlock5Text5P5
data.value: If you’re on the Free and Viewer Plan, you can share with only 1 email address at a time.

data.name: AxCPMGDBlock6Heading
data.value: Follow these steps to share

data.name: AxCPMGDBlock6Text1
data.value: Click any of the password item you’d like to share.

data.name: AxCPMGDBlock6Text2
data.value: Click the Shared With action button to toggle down the share secret section.

data.name: AxCPMGDBlock6Text3
data.value: Choose the visibility option and click Add.

data.name: AxCPMGDBlock6Text4
data.value: Click the Share Access button to apply the share with added emails.

data.name: AxCPMGDBlock6Text5
data.value: In the password manager list, Shared avatar icon will appear on the shared password item.

data.name: AxCPMGDBlock7Heading
data.value: Follow these steps to unshare

data.name: AxCPMGDBlock7Text1
data.value: Click any of the password item you’d like to unshare.

data.name: AxCPMGDBlock7Text3
data.value: Click on the three-dot-menu icon on the shared users email address.

data.name: AxCPMGDBlock7Text4
data.value: Click Unshare.

data.name: AxCPMGDBlock7Text5
data.value: Click the Share Access button to apply the changes.

data.name: AxCPMGDBlock8Heading
data.value: What’s Next?

data.name: AxCPMGDBlock8Text1
data.value: Check out our plans and pricing to compare and choose the best plan for you: https://axcrypt.net/pricing/.

data.name: AxCPMGDBlock8Text2
data.value: Want to dive deeper into encryption best practices? Check out our blog: https://axcrypt.net/blog/.

data.name: AxCPMGDBlock8Text3
data.value: Check out AxCrypt security page: https://axcrypt.net/information/security/

data.name: AxCryptAboutDescription
data.value:
File Security For You and Your Team by AxCrypt AB
Includes software from http://www.bouncycastle.org/ .

data.name: AxCryptAffiliateHeading
data.value: Become an AxCrypt’s Affiliate!

data.name: AxCryptAffiliateInfoText
data.value: Join as an AxCrypt Affiliate and earn top commissions on every sale.

data.name: AxCryptAwardwinningText
data.value: AxCrypt award-winning & easy to use encryption software helps your organisation to comply with data security and encryption requirements.Try it free for 30-days to see how it works.

data.name: AxCryptBetaWarning
data.value:
Warning! This is untested beta software. This means that it may be missing features and be unstable. Texts may be missing and user interface might be incomplete.
Use with care and ensure you have up-to-date backups of all your data. Please report any issues to support@axcrypt.net .
You have been warned, now enjoy!

data.name: AxcryptBusinessBlock1Heading
data.value: Introduction

data.name: AxcryptBusinessBlock1Text1
data.value: Anyone can use the AxCrypt free plans.

data.name: AxcryptBusinessBlock1Text2
data.value: For extended functionality we offer two plans for purchase, Premium and Business.

data.name: AxcryptBusinessBlock1Text3
data.value: The Premium plan is intended for private individuals only, not organizations.

data.name: AxcryptBusinessBlock1Text4
data.value: The Business plan is intended for organizations, not private individuals.

data.name: AxcryptBusinessBlock1Text5
data.value: For full conditions, please see our terms of use.

data.name: AxcryptBusinessBlock1Text6
data.value: Please see our pricing for details.

data.name: AxcryptBusinessBlock1Text7
data.value: A Business subscription lets your organization purchase and manage licenses for multiple users. We also offer VAT free sales within the EU for qualifying companies (you must supply a valid EU VAT number and address) for the Business plan. We do not offer VAT free sales for the Premium plan.

data.name: AxcryptBusinessBlock2Heading
data.value: Create a Business Subscription

data.name: AxcryptBusinessBlock2Text1
data.value: You need to be signed in with an AxCrypt ID at our web site. Use the Business Subscription menu to create a subscription.

data.name: AxcryptBusinessBlock2Text2
data.value: Creating a subscription requires an initial purchase of at least one member license, yourself. When you create and purchase a Business subscription you are automatically designated administrator, so you can assign the subscription member licenses to users of your choice and perform other administrative tasks.

data.name: AxcryptBusinessBlock2Text3
data.value: Start by deciding the number of initial member licenses you need, in addition to yourself. You can always add more later.

data.name: AxcryptBusinessBlock2Text4
data.value: Once you have decided the member licenses, have a valid credit card ready, select a currency and enter the name, address and EU VAT number if applicable.

data.name: AxcryptBusinessBlock2Text5
data.value: When all is entered you will be presented with a total amount, and a calculation showing your discount (if provided) and VAT being applied.

data.name: AxcryptBusinessBlock2Text6
data.value: Click the button with the credit card logo, and complete the purchase. If all goes well, you are now ready to manage your Business subscription.

data.name: AxcryptBusinessBlock3Heading
data.value: Manage a Business Subscription

data.name: AxcryptBusinessBlock3Text1
data.value: You need to be signed in with an AxCrypt ID at our web site, and be the designated administrator for at least one Business subscription. Use the Business Subscription menu to manage a subscription.

data.name: AxcryptBusinessBlock3Text2
data.value: Add and remove members as appropriate. You cannot remove yourself as an administrator or from the subscription.

data.name: AxcryptBusinessBlock3Text3
data.value: If you add a member who does not have registered AxCrypt ID, they will receive an invitation email with instructions on how to proceed. Members with existing AxCrypt IDs will receive a welcome email instead.

data.name: AxcryptBusinessBlock4Heading
data.value: Update Information for Business Subscription

data.name: AxcryptBusinessBlock4Text1
data.value: You need to be signed in with an AxCrypt ID at our web site, and be the designated administrator for at least one Business subscription. Use the Business Subscription menu to update the information for a subscription.

data.name: AxcryptBusinessBlock4Text2
data.value: The information we store about a subscription is limited to name, address and EU VAT Number if applicable.

data.name: AxcryptBusinessBlock4Text3
data.value: Using the information page for Business subscriptions, you can update this information.

data.name: AxcryptBusinessBlock5Heading
data.value: Purchase for Business Subscription

data.name: AxcryptBusinessBlock5Text1
data.value: You need to be signed in with an AxCrypt ID at our web site, and be the designated administrator for at least one Business subscription. Use the Business Subscription menu to purchase additional members or time for a subscription.

data.name: AxcryptBusinessBlock5Text2
data.value: The initial creation of a subscription includes the purchase of an initial number of member licenses for a month or year, depending on the plan you chose.

data.name: AxcryptBusinessBlock5Text3
data.value: Should you wish to add more members to a subscription, you can do so at any time.

data.name: AxcryptBusinessBlock5Text4
data.value: When you purchase additional member licenses, it is always for your current subscription period. So, if you have 5 months left until the whole subscription is up for renewal, additional member licenses will only require payment for the remaining 5 months. Time left is always calculated as whole months, so 50 days will count as two full months.

data.name: AxcryptBusinessBlock5Text5
data.value: Your paid subscription will automatically renew at the end of the subscription period, using the initial payment method. If you want to cancel, you must do so before the end of the current subscription period.

data.name: AxcryptBusinessBlock6Heading
data.value: Pricing

data.name: AxcryptBusinessBlock6Text1
data.value: The AxCrypt Business subscription plan is for one or more member licenses.

data.name: AxcryptBusinessBlock6Text2
data.value: For current pricing in relevant currencies visit our pricing page.

data.name: AxcryptBusinessBlock6Text3
data.value: For the purposes of a subscription, a month is defined as 30 days and a year as 360 days.

data.name: AxcryptBusinessBlock6Text4
data.value: When a subscription is created or renewed, the period is a month or a year, depending on the plan you chose.

data.name: AxcryptBusinessBlock6Text5
data.value: When additional members licenses are purchased for a subscription within the subscription period, only the remaining months rounded upwards to whole months are charged for. If 50 days remain for the current period, and additional members are added, this will be for 2 months/additional member.

data.name: AxcryptBusinessGuideBlock1Text1
data.value: AxCrypt offers a free plan that anyone can use. For extended functionality, we provide two paid plans: Premium and Business.

data.name: AxcryptBusinessGuideBlock1Text2
data.value: Premium Plan: Intended for private individuals, not for organizations.

data.name: AxcryptBusinessGuideBlock1Text3
data.value: Business Plan: Designed for organizations, allowing you to purchase and manage licenses for multiple users.

data.name: AxcryptBusinessGuideBlock1Text4
data.value: For detailed terms, please refer to our Terms of Use. You can also check out our Pricing page for more information.

data.name: AxcryptBusinessGuideBlock1Text5
data.value: A Business subscription enables organizations to purchase and manage licenses for multiple users. For EU-based companies with a valid VAT number, we offer VAT-free purchases on the Business plan. Please note that VAT-free sales are not available for the Premium plan.

data.name: AxcryptBusinessGuideBlock2Text1
data.value: Sign-up for AxCrypt Business and login using your account credentials.

data.name: AxcryptBusinessGuideBlock2Text2
data.value: Enter your business details, including your company name, address, and EU VAT number.

data.name: AxcryptBusinessGuideBlock2Text3
data.value: Choose the number of member licenses you need, with the first assigned to you as the administrator. You can always add more later. Enter your business details and payment information to complete the setup.

data.name: AxcryptBusinessGuideBlock2Text4
data.value: You will be presented with a total amount, and a calculation showing your discount (if provided) and VAT being applied. Click the button with the credit card logo, and complete the purchase.

data.name: AxcryptBusinessGuideBlock2Text5
data.value: Note: Upon completing the purchase, you are automatically designated as the administrator.

data.name: AxcryptBusinessGuideBlock3Heading
data.value: Manage Your Business Subscription

data.name: AxcryptBusinessGuideBlock3SubHeading3
data.value: Add or Remove Members:

data.name: AxcryptBusinessGuideBlock3Text1
data.value: Sign in with an AxCrypt ID on our website and ensure that you are designated as the administrator.

data.name: AxcryptBusinessGuideBlock3Text2
data.value: You can update your business name, address, and EU VAT number (if applicable) in the AxCrypt ID section. Please note that the information we store is limited to these details.

data.name: AxcryptBusinessGuideBlock3Text3
data.value: As the administrator, you can add or remove members as necessary:

data.name: AxcryptBusinessGuideBlock3Text4
data.value: If there is a new member who doesn’t have an AxCrypt ID, they will receive an invitation email to create one.

data.name: AxcryptBusinessGuideBlock3Text5
data.value: Existing AxCrypt users will receive a welcome email upon being added.

data.name: AxcryptBusinessGuideBlock3Text6
data.value: Note:You cannot remove yourself as the administrator or from the subscription.

data.name: AxcryptBusinessGuideBlock4Heading2
data.value: Add Users to Groups:

data.name: AxcryptBusinessGuideBlock4Heading3
data.value: Remove Existing Users:

data.name: AxcryptBusinessGuideBlock4Heading4
data.value: Update Existing User Role:

data.name: AxcryptBusinessGuideBlock4Text1
data.value: Efficiently manage your AxCrypt Business subscription by adding, removing, or updating user roles.

data.name: AxcryptBusinessGuideBlock4Text2
data.value: Navigate to Add Users and either manually enter the email addresses or import a list in the form of .txt or .csv files. Users will be added according to your available license capacity.

data.name: AxcryptBusinessGuideBlock4Text3P1
data.value: Go to Groups section, where you can select an existing Group or create a new one to add existing/new users based on available licenses. Users can directly be added to business and group together.

data.name: AxcryptBusinessGuideBlock4Text3P2
data.value: For detailed instructions on managing groups, refer to the Group Management Guide.

data.name: AxcryptBusinessGuideBlock4Text4P1
data.value: Ensure that no group is selected during the process. Select the user by checking the box next to their name.

data.name: AxcryptBusinessGuideBlock4Text4P2
data.value: In the action menu, choose Delete to remove the user from your subscription.

data.name: AxcryptBusinessGuideBlock4Text5P1
data.value: Navigate to the Users section in your account.

data.name: AxcryptBusinessGuideBlock4Text5P2
data.value: Update the user’s role from a standard user to user admin, or vice versa.

data.name: AxcryptBusinessGuideBlock4Text6
data.value: Note: There must always be at least one active admin in your subscription.

data.name: AxcryptBusinessGuideBlock5Heading
data.value: Purchase Additional Licenses

data.name: AxcryptBusinessGuideBlock5Heading1
data.value: Understand the Billing Period:

data.name: AxcryptBusinessGuideBlock5Heading2
data.value: Automatic Renewal:

data.name: AxcryptBusinessGuideBlock5Text1
data.value: You can purchase additional member licenses for your Business by following either of the following two ways:

data.name: AxcryptBusinessGuideBlock5Text3
data.value: Subscription Details: You can purchase more licenses and add members directly through the subscription Details.

data.name: AxcryptBusinessGuideBlock5Text4
data.value: User Section: You can also add more users through the user section in the business subscription, but only when all existing licenses are used. The option to add more users will appear only in this case.

data.name: AxcryptBusinessGuideBlock5Text5
data.value: This ensures a smooth process for managing user access and expanding your team.

data.name: AxcryptBusinessGuideBlock5Text6
data.value: When you purchase additional member licenses, it is always for your current subscription period. So, if you have 5 months left until the whole subscription is up for renewal, additional member licenses will only require payment for the remaining 5 months. Time left is always calculated as whole months, so 50 days will count as two full months.

data.name: AxcryptBusinessGuideBlock5Text7
data.value: Your subscription will automatically renew at the end of the current period using the original payment method. To cancel, you must do so before the end of the subscription period.

data.name: AxcryptBusinessGuideBlock6Heading
data.value: Pricing Details

data.name: AxcryptBusinessGuideBlock6Text1
data.value: For current pricing and relevant currencies, visit our Pricing page.

data.name: AxcryptBusinessGuideBlock6Text2
data.value: Subscription periods are defined as 30 days for a month and 360 days for a year.

data.name: AxcryptBusinessGuideBlock6Text3
data.value: When a subscription is created or renewed, the period is a month or a year, depending on the plan you chose.

data.name: AxcryptBusinessGuideBlock6Text4
data.value: Start securing your organization with AxCrypt Business!

data.name: AxcryptBusinessGuideBlock7Text1
data.value: If you are looking to efficiently manage users and file access within your organization, explore our Group Management Guide.

data.name: BetaTrialFaq1
data.value: What are the main goals of the beta trial?

data.name: BetaTrialFaq1Ans
data.value: The beta trial aims to gather user feedback on new features and ensure the software's stability before the official release.

data.name: BetaTrialFaq2
data.value: What can I expect during the beta testing phase?

data.name: BetaTrialFaq2Ans
data.value: During the beta testing phase, you can explore new features, provide feedback, and help us identify any issues to enhance the final product.

data.name: BetaTrialFaq3
data.value: Is this version available on other platforms?

data.name: BetaTrialFaq3Ans
data.value: Currently, the beta is exclusively for Windows users.

data.name: BetaTrialFaq4
data.value: What kind of feedback are you looking for?

data.name: BetaTrialFaq4Ans
data.value: We welcome all feedback, especially regarding performance, usability, features, and any issues you encounter.

data.name: BetaTrialFaq5
data.value: What if I encounter bugs or issues during the beta?

data.name: BetaTrialFaq5Ans
data.value: If you encounter any bugs or issues, please report them through our feedback form. Your input helps us resolve issues before the official release.

data.name: BetaTrialFaq6
data.value: Will my data be safe while using the beta version?

data.name: BetaTrialFaq6Ans
data.value: Yes, your data security is our top priority. The beta version maintains the same high standards of encryption as the current version of AxCrypt.

data.name: BetaTrialFaq7
data.value: Can I revert to the previous version after trying the beta?

data.name: BetaTrialFaq7Ans
data.value: Yes, you can revert to the previous version if needed. When you decide to leave the beta, simply download the current AxCrypt application, log in, and start using that version. All your encrypted data will remain intact during the process.

data.name: BetaTrialFaq8
data.value: Will there be updates during the beta testing phase?

data.name: BetaTrialFaq8Ans
data.value: Yes, we plan to release updates based on user feedback and any issues that arise during the trial.

data.name: Blog_5KFESSAO_H1_Text1
data.value: When selecting an encryption software, you must look into its algorithms to determine how your data will be secured or protected. For starters, an encryption algorithm transforms plain text into the encrypted text to prevent hackers from quickly accessing them.

data.name: Blog_5KFESSAO_H1_Text2
data.value: However, since not all codes or algorithms are equal, some perform faster than the others. To help you better, here are 5 common encryption algorithms that are most undoubtedly unbreakable:

data.name: Blog_5KFESSAO_H1_Text3
data.value: • Triple DES – it is a symmetric key method for data encryption. It uses the same key to encipher and decipher messages.

data.name: Blog_5KFESSAO_H1_Text4
data.value: • RSA – it uses an asymmetric method of encrypting data. In other words, it uses multiple keys for encrypting and decrypting data. These keys are commonly known as “public key” and “private key”.

data.name: Blog_5KFESSAO_H1_Text5
data.value: • Blowfish – it is a symmetric but general-purpose algorithm. It is highly prevalent in cryptographic software because of its speed, flexibility, and competitiveness, among other encryption algorithms.

data.name: Blog_5KFESSAO_H1_Text6
data.value: • Twofish – it is a brainchild of Blowfish. It is also flexible and uses a symmetric encryption method. However, Twofish encrypts data of up to 256-bit, while its predecessor only encrypts data of up to 64-bit.

data.name: Blog_5KFESSAO_H1_Text7
data.value: • AES – also a symmetric encryption algorithm, it became popular because of its easy implementation. Compared to other competitors, it has a more complex algorithm and is considered to be more effective.

data.name: Blog_5KFESSAO_H2_Text1
data.value: For some, encrypting data, such as their files’ content, is already enough to ensure its security. However, if you only encrypt the actual data stored, unauthorized users may still have access to view file names, archives, and the like.

data.name: Blog_5KFESSAO_H2_Text2
data.value: Besides, other people may derive information from having access to your file names. And for someone who wants to protect sensitive company files and other personal data, this can be quite worrisome.

data.name: Blog_5KFESSAO_H2_Text3
data.value: For this reason, it is crucial that your encryption software has a feature that lets you encrypt file names. This feature should prevent other people from seeing your file name and require them with a key or password before accessing it. If you want an extra layer of protection to your files, the file name encryption feature can undoubtedly come in handy.

data.name: Blog_5KFESSAO_H2_Text4
data.value: On a different note, you might want to check out this article about the various human errors that impact data security.

data.name: Blog_5KFESSAO_H3_Text1
data.value: As much as you want to protect all the information from your current files, you might also want to protect the data from the files that you want to discard. Since this information may contain sensitive or relevant content to your other files, it is vital to ensure their protection up to the deletion process.

data.name: Blog_5KFESSAO_H3_Text2
data.value: Hence, when selecting an encryption software, consider looking for a secure deletion feature that lets you securely delete files and wipe free space. Remember that with secure deletion, you can ensure that your files can no longer be restored or retrieved. This way, sensitive data is highly protected and prevents outsiders from accessing these discarded files. Hence, your file management software should have tight security features.

data.name: Blog_5KFESSAO_H4_Text1
data.value: Passwords are extremely valuable, most especially when you are protecting confidential information or projects. These days, however, hackers are more persistent and can obtain passwords quickly. But, what a better way to protect data more effectively than the implementation of a two-factor authentication functionality?

data.name: Blog_5KFESSAO_H4_Text2
data.value: As of June 2019, a study from Statista shows that 62% of security-aware IT professionals in

data.name: Blog_5KFESSAO_H4_Text3
data.value: North America stated that their company uses two-factor authentication to verify their identity. On the other hand, 52% use a single-on.

data.name: Blog_5KFESSAO_H4_Text4
data.value: This feature should be one of the top things you should consider before committing to a specific encryption software. Adding an extra layer of security not only strengthens security, but it also reduces the risk of cyber breaches to help you build secure online relationships. This can help your company become more credible; hence, it allows you to create a trustworthy reputation among your customers.

data.name: Blog_5KFESSAO_H5_Text1
data.value: Typically, employees share relevant and work-related information with each other. However, worrying about the data’s security during the sharing process is inevitable. Since this raises concern about sharing secured files, it is incredibly vital for an encryption software to have a feature that lets you share and receive files more securely.

data.name: Blog_5KFESSAO_H5_Text2
data.value: With the key sharing feature, you can share files without the need to share passwords. Instead, you can share file keys to specific colleagues to give them access to particular files. Then, they can easily browse or edit the shared file. Even more so, it should allow you to unshare the file to remove the person’s access quickly.

data.name: Blog_5KFESSAO_H5_Text3
data.value: In addition, one thing that you must bear in mind when it comes to file sharing is to avoid self-decrypting files. Often, these are self-contained executable files. However, since these contain strongly encrypted information, screening for anti-virus is almost impossible. To learn more, you can read this article about why you should avoid self-decrypting files.

data.name: Blog_5KFESSAO_H6_Text1
data.value: The purpose of encryption software does not only focus on ensuring highly secured data. It also allows you to determine the threats that you might encounter beforehand and help you avoid them in the long run. The best file encryption software should have the ability to meet all of your requirements and provide additional functionalities that can come in handy.

data.name: Blog_5KFESSAO_H6_Text2
data.value: How do you encrypt a file system? This is one of the questions that should leave your mind once you find the right encryption software. Aside from that, you can consider asking these questions when looking for the perfect tool:

data.name: Blog_5KFESSAO_H6_Text3
data.value: • Does it match the threats you want to prevent?

data.name: Blog_5KFESSAO_H6_Text4
data.value: • Does it require technical support?

data.name: Blog_5KFESSAO_H6_Text5
data.value: • Is it compatible with the current applications you are using?

data.name: Blog_5KFESSAO_H6_Text6
data.value: • At what layers do you want to encrypt data?

data.name: Blog_5KFESSAO_H6_Text7
data.value: • Can it recover encrypted data when keys are lost?

data.name: Blog_5KFESSAO_Heading1
data.value: 1. Encryption algorithm

data.name: Blog_5KFESSAO_Heading2
data.value: 2. Filename encryption

data.name: Blog_5KFESSAO_Heading3
data.value: 3. Secure deletion

data.name: Blog_5KFESSAO_Heading4
data.value: 4.Two-factor authentication

data.name: Blog_5KFESSAO_Heading5
data.value: 5. Key sharing

data.name: Blog_5KFESSAO_Heading6
data.value: Why is encryption software a need, and what is next?

data.name: Blog_5KFESSAO_Summary
data.value: With today’s digital advancement, it is inevitable to encounter challenges when it comes to your files’ security. For companies, protecting sensitive data and personal information of both employees and customers should be their utmost priority.

data.name: Blog_5KFESSAO_Text1
data.value: With today’s digital advancement, it is inevitable to encounter challenges when it comes to your files’ security. For companies, protecting sensitive data and personal information of both employees and customers should be their utmost priority. So what are the specific tools you need to ensure their data are protected?

data.name: Blog_5KFESSAO_Text2
data.value: Fortunately, today’s digital advancement also brings about many advantages in providing the solutions you need.In this case, one of the best ways to protect your files is by encrypting them. When you encrypt your files, you can easily prevent unauthorized data access, File tampering, and data loss. In addition to that, you can read this article to learn what encryption is about.

data.name: Blog_5KFESSAO_Text3
data.value: According to a survey of Statista, 52% of respondents encrypt employee or human resources data within their enterprises. Through the process of encryption, your data is concealed by translating them into codes to keep them hidden from unauthorized users. There are several file encryption methods you can use to do this.

data.name: Blog_5KFESSAO_Text4
data.value: On that note, if you have finally decided to invest in an encryption software, checking its features should be the first thing you must consider. With that said, this article will provide some of encryption software’s features to make things easier for you. Here are 5 key features of encryption software that you should be aware of.

data.name: Blog_5KFESSAO_Title
data.value: 5 Key features of Encryption Software you Should be Aware Of

data.name: Blog_5RWEISB_H1_Text1
data.value: Cyberattacks are increasing in frequency and sophistication, with SMBs being particularly vulnerable. In 2020, over 700,000 attacks against small businesses caused $2.8 billion in damages. Hackers often see SMBs as easy targets due to their limited security infrastructure. Malware is the most common type of cyberattack aimed at small businesses, accounting for 18% of attacks. SMB cybersecurity is more critical than ever, making small business encryption a necessary defense. Implementing strong file security for SMBs can prevent unauthorized access, ensuring SMB data protection even if a breach occurs.

data.name: Blog_5RWEISB_H2_Text1
data.value: Governments worldwide are enforcing stricter data protection laws, requiring businesses to secure customer and employee data. Regulations such as the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and the California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) mandate robust security measures, including encryption. Failing to comply can lead to hefty fines and legal trouble. By encrypting sensitive files, SMBs can meet regulatory requirements and avoid financial and reputational damage. However, only 14% of SMBs currently have a cybersecurity plan in place, highlighting the urgent need for stronger SMB data protection measures.

data.name: Blog_5RWEISB_H3_Text1
data.value: Not all data breaches occur due to external attacks; insider threats, whether intentional or accidental, can be just as damaging. Employees may mishandle data, fall victim to phishing scams, or misuse access privileges. Alarmingly, 95% of cybersecurity breaches are attributed to human error. Approximately 1 in 323 emails sent to small businesses are malicious, further increasing the risk. Encryption helps mitigate the impact of such threats by restricting access to only authorized individuals and ensuring that data remains secure even if leaked.

data.name: Blog_5RWEISB_H4_Text1
data.value: The shift toward remote work and cloud-based operations has increased the need for strong security measures. Employees frequently access company data from various locations and devices, making it important to protect information at rest and in transit. Small Business encryption ensures that sensitive files stored in the cloud or shared online remain protected from unauthorized access. With 51% of small businesses lacking any IT security measures and 43% lacking a recovery plan, encryption becomes even more critical in safeguarding operations.

data.name: Blog_5RWEISB_H5_Text1
data.value: A data breach can severely damage an SMB’s reputation, leading to loss of customer trust and financial setbacks. Studies show that on average, SMBs lose $25,000 due to cyberattacks, and 78% of SMBs worry that a serious cyberattack could put them out of business. Implementing encryption demonstrates a commitment to protecting sensitive information, fostering trust, and enhancing brand credibility. Businesses that invest in security measures are more likely to attract and retain customers in an increasingly data-conscious environment.

data.name: Blog_5RWEISB_H5_Text2
data.value: AxCrypt provides the best encryption solutions with advanced features for SMBs. With Group Management, businesses can efficiently manage user access. Key Sharing ensures secure collaboration without exposing passwords. Centralized Key Management simplifies encryption for teams, reducing complexity while enhancing security. By choosing AxCrypt, SMBs gain a powerful yet user-friendly encryption tool to safeguard sensitive data effectively. Investing in encryption today will secure your business for the future.

data.name: Blog_5RWEISB_Heading1
data.value: 1. Rising Cybersecurity Threats

data.name: Blog_5RWEISB_Heading2
data.value: 2. Compliance with Data Protection Regulations

data.name: Blog_5RWEISB_Heading3
data.value: 3. Protection Against Insider Threats

data.name: Blog_5RWEISB_Heading4
data.value: 4. Secure Remote Work and Cloud Storage

data.name: Blog_5RWEISB_Heading5
data.value: 5. Maintaining Customer Trust and Business Reputation

data.name: Blog_5RWEISB_Summary
data.value: In 2025, encrypting sensitive business data isn’t optional—it’s essential for SMBs to stay protected. Here are five key reasons why encryption should be a fundamental part of every SMB’s data protection strategy.

data.name: Blog_5RWEISB_Text1
data.value: Small and medium-sized businesses (SMBs) are becoming prime targets for cyber threats, making data security a top priority. In 2025, encrypting sensitive business data isn’t optional—it’s essential for SMBs to stay protected. Here are five key reasons why encryption should be a fundamental part of every SMB’s data protection strategy.

data.name: Blog_5RWEISB_Text2
data.value: Read more about the key aspects of SMB cybersecurity from this blog

data.name: Blog_5RWEISB_Title
data.value: 5 Reasons Why Encryption is Important for Small Businesses

data.name: Blog_ADGE_Conclusion_Heading
data.value: Get started with AxCrypt...

data.name: Blog_ADGE_Conclusion_TExt1
data.value: Consider encryption as a kind of insurance against potential data breaches. Security may become an asset with a boulder, enterprise-grade encryption and key management tool. You get the option of moving to the public cloud. If you're interested in learning more about encryption, start here.

data.name: Blog_ADGE_H1_Text1
data.value: When you discuss encryption with someone who isn't a security expert, you'll typically get a number of responses. Encryption is frequently misunderstood as some kind of sinister technology. Instead, encryption can help in achieving flexibility, compliance, and data privacy that today's virtual age requires.

data.name: Blog_ADGE_H1_Text2
data.value: Encryption is the process of transforming plain text into ciphertext, or changing readable text into unreadable text, in order to protect data so that only certain people can access it. Encryption scrambles, or encrypts data and then utilises a key to unscramble or decrypt the information for the receiving party. It proves to be a successful method of safeguarding sensitive data. Data on computers and storage devices, as well as data in transit through networks, are all protected with encryption.

data.name: Blog_ADGE_H2_SH2_Text1
data.value: Intercepting emails and other content is just one example of a number of incidents that have occurred in less formal methods. While most emails do not pique the curiosity of other parties enough for them to try to intercept it, there have been instances where this has happened. Emails are not encrypted by default as they travel from your servers to the recipient. This implies that if hackers gain access to this information, they will be able to view your emails and confidential information.

data.name: Blog_ADGE_H2_SH3_Text1
data.value: According to a data breach report, employees are directly or indirectly responsible for 34 percent of total attacks. Content can be misappropriated by disgruntled employees or contractors for their own or others' benefit. Any intentional loophole can bring down a whole organization with millions of stolen data. This danger can be mitigated by imposing the appropriate set of access rules to keep privileged users in their “swim lanes”. For instance, the Master Key feature eliminates the risk of losing access to critical files. Check out AxCrypt´s Master Key feature here.

data.name: Blog_ADGE_H2_SH4_Text1
data.value: If the data is not encrypted, the most significant consequence will be the compromise of critical or confidential information by a cyber attack or interference of a third party. If protocols aren't in place to identify any kind of behaviour, organisations can lose large amounts of data before realising it.

data.name: Blog_ADGE_H2_SH5_Text1
data.value: With more businesses moving to the cloud, security measures must be constantly checked and updated to protect data from leaks. Despite the fact that cloud programmes like Google or Microsoft are well-equipped with security on their end, the user end is still a major source of erroneous mistakes, malicious software, and fraudulent assaults.

data.name: Blog_ADGE_H2_SubHeading2
data.value: Emails can be hacked

data.name: Blog_ADGE_H2_SubHeading3
data.value: Insider threat

data.name: Blog_ADGE_H2_SubHeading4
data.value: Malicious activity by third party

data.name: Blog_ADGE_H2_SubHeading5
data.value: Cloud vulnerability

data.name: Blog_ADGE_H3_Text1
data.value: To begin the process of encryption, you need to collect the data you intend to encrypt. The algorithm will then use the encryption key to modify the data in the input and send the result. The output would be a scrambled text that could only be read by the person with the key; you could then transfer the output to the second party via any medium, or preserve the encrypted data for future use. Keys are usually generated with random number generators, or computer algorithms.

data.name: Blog_ADGE_H3_Text2
data.value: AxCrypt allows you to take advantage of virtualization's flexibility while maintaining control over your data. It uniquely removes the barriers to adopting an encryption solution.

data.name: Blog_ADGE_H4_SH1_Text1
data.value: AxCrypt provides you with free software with 256-bit strong encryption. This boosts data security and minimises the danger of breaches. If you have a large organisation, you can review our business plan here which has more advanced features.

data.name: Blog_ADGE_H4_SH2_Text1
data.value: With the key sharing feature, AxCrypt has made it simple to open files with any team member with whom you share the key, allowing you to collaborate with your team even if you are separated by thousands of miles.

data.name: Blog_ADGE_H4_SH3_Text1
data.value: Many people and businesses are hesitant to move sensitive data to the cloud because they believe it is unsafe. But with AxCrypt data is encrypted in flight, at rest and in storage. You maintain control over your encryption keys, so even after data has left your building, you remain in command.

data.name: Blog_ADGE_H4_SH3_Text6
data.value: Physical theft of computers and storage is a possibility in many firms with remote offices. Many of these have sensitive and vulnerable data on these servers, such as financial advisers and tax accountants. Encrypting data on these servers protects against data theft and loss. With the AxCrypt master key functionality, you can be assured that remote servers are secure and that no one in the remote offices can control encryption key access.

data.name: Blog_ADGE_H4_SH4_Text1
data.value: Assume you need to move your operations from one cloud provider to another. You can shut down your old computer and transfer it to the new provider using encryption, and then direct the system to produce a new key. Then, by ordering the machine to shred the old key, you can withdraw from the old cloud provider. All of your data, including copies and backups, kept by the previous provider will be lost.

data.name: Blog_ADSDE_H1_Text1
data.value: A cyberattack is a hostile and purposeful attempt by a party to infiltrate another’s information. Typically, the attacker hopes to gain some sort of advantage by interrupting the victim's network. Every year, hackers strive to profit from unprotected corporate systems, due to which cybercrime has risen. Since the start of the pandemic, there has been a 300% increase in reported cybercrimes around the world.

data.name: Blog_ADSDE_H2_SH1_Text1
data.value: Cyber assaults against businesses or individuals are initiated by criminal groups, state actors, or private individuals. Cybercriminals primarily target sensitive personal data, business financial data, customer databases (including personally identifiable information [PII], email addresses, and login credentials), intellectual property, and IT services (such as payment processing).

data.name: Blog_ADSDE_H2_SH1_Text2
data.value: Reasons for cyberattacks include reconnaissance, spying to acquire an unfair competitive edge, and intellectual challenge. Financially motivated cybercriminals seek financial gain through data theft or business disruption. Likewise, the personally motivated, such as current or former employees seeking retribution, will also target money and data.

data.name: Blog_ADSDE_H2_SH2_Text1
data.value: Securing pdf files, folders, and other data has become a necessity in our digital era. Anyone with access to a user database on a company's servers (including hackers) might simply examine any stored passwords if the passwords were not encrypted. With the advancement of technology, hackers are upping their game in terms of snooping around data. Here are a few tips on how to keep your data protected..

data.value: The world is dominated by online communities, online transactions, cloud computing, and automated procedures. To avoid loss of control, illegal disclosure, unlawful acquisition, and access for an unauthorized purpose, it is important to safeguard data. As technology advances, it creates new attack types, tools, and strategies that enable attackers to breach more complicated or well-controlled systems, including mobile phones.

data.name: Blog_AESDES_Conclusion
data.value: As a result, while both AES and DES are symmetric key block ciphers, AES is the de facto industry standard and is hence more secure. When it comes to encryption, security is crucial, and the only alternative is AxCrypt, which offers 256-bit encryption in addition to security. All concerns with encryption are resolved by AxCrypt.

data.name: Blog_AESDES_H1_SH1_Text1
data.value: Data Encryption Standard is what it stands for. The DES algorithm can be cracked using specific devices. A key with a 56-bit size is used by the DES algorithm. The DES creates a block of 64-bit cipher text using the 56-bit key after receiving a block of 64-bit plain text as an input.

data.name: Blog_AESDES_H1_SH1_Text2
data.value: Although both AES and DES being the encryption algorithm to encrypt data, there are significant differences between the both, in terms of their working principles, their core functions, their key sizes and their speed and security performances.

data.name: Blog_AESDES_H1_SubHeading1
data.value: What is DES encryption?

data.name: Blog_AESDES_H1_Text1
data.value: AES or the Advanced Encryption Standard is a cipher, which is a way to both encrypt and decrypt data. There's a significant probability that your data will be encrypted by some type of AES cipher, such as the AES 256, 192, or 128 -- whenever you transmit files through secure file transfer protocols like HTTPS, FTPS, SFTP, WebDAV, OFTP, or AS2.

data.name: Blog_AESDES_H2_SH1_Text1
data.value: For any cipher, the most basic technique of attack is brute force, which includes attempting each key until you locate the appropriate one. Finding the right key would take a maximum of 256, or around 72 quadrillion, attempts due to the effective DES key length of 56 bits. This is insufficient for the DES data protection against computerized brute-force attacks. Before AES was used to replace DES, there were probably not many messages that were susceptible to this kind of code-breaking attempt. However, even before DES became a standard, many security experts believed the 56-bit key length was insufficient. So, it’s no longer effective.

data.name: Blog_AESDES_H2_SH2_Text1
data.value: Although the AES data encryption technique is more theoretically sophisticated and attractive, its main advantage is the availability of different key lengths. AES is exponentially more secure than DES's 56-bit key since it lets you select a 128-bit, 192-bit, or 256-bit key. Because key size affects encryption strength, DES became obsolete due to continual advancements in computing technology.

data.name: Blog_AESDES_H2_SubHeading1
data.value: Why DES is no longer effective? .

data.name: Blog_AESDES_H2_SubHeading2
data.value: Why AES replaces DES?

data.name: Blog_AMEFH_Conclusion_Text1
data.value: Encrypting your mobile devices is a highly rational decision given the amount of sensitive personal information that we carry on our mobile devices these days, including banking details, personal information, and other information. Now that you understand the need for an encrypted phone, encrypt all of your mobile devices with reliable software such as AxCrypt to protect your data from unauthorized access.

data.name: Blog_AMEFH_H1_SH1_Text1
data.value: Phishing assaults have surged sixfold during the pandemic, and mobile devices are now the primary target. Scammers are aware that people who work from home spend more time on their mobile and do not take the same safety measures as they would on a traditional PC. Anyone who stumbles across your phone or laptop can easily access the files contained within; however, with encryption, accessing that data is extremely tough.

data.name: Blog_AMEFH_H1_SH2_Text1
data.value: A data leak occurs when sensitive information is transferred unintentionally from a mobile device to an internet service. If the device fails to protect data effectively, the data then becomes available to anybody who uses the same network as the device.

data.name: Blog_AMEFH_H1_SH3_Text1
data.value: We live in an era where we're all continuously connected to networks that aren't always secure. According to researchers, mobile devices utilize Wi-Fi nearly three times as much as data. Almost a quarter of devices connect to unsecured Wi-Fi networks, and 4% of devices are subjected to a man-in-the-middle attack.

data.value: Why is mobile encryption needed?

data.name: Blog_AMEFH_Heading2
data.value: Mobile Encryption with AxCrypt

data.name: Blog_AMEFH_SH1_Text1
data.value: Mobile encryption goes above and beyond a regular lock screen password. It is a one-stop for safeguarding all of your personal information and data on your mobile phones from prying eyes or if your mobile gets lost or stolen. Encryption stores your phone's information in an unreadable, jumbled format that can only be read with the correct credentials. This means that if your phone falls into the wrong hands, no one will be able to decipher any of the data unless they know your password.

data.name: Blog_AMEFH_SH1_Text2
data.value: From saving your data from getting compromised to making your personal details super-secret, mobile encryption can do it all for you. A misplaced or abandoned device poses a significant security risk; particularly if it lacks a strong PIN or password, as well as full data encryption. Sensitive documents and files in the device will be vulnerable to theft. If an encrypted device, on the other hand, falls into the wrong hands or is lost, the owner may rest assured that his or her data is secure and will not be viewed by outsiders without the key.

data.name: Blog_ANYANEFSWA_H1_Text1
data.value: Last year, we achieved significant milestones that not only marked our success but also strengthened your cybersecurity. As we step into 2025, we're excited to share how we’ve made AxCrypt even stronger to face future challenges.

data.name: Blog_ANYANEFSWA_H1_Text10
data.value: • Supporting Academia with the Student Plan

data.name: Blog_ANYANEFSWA_H1_Text11
data.value: Recognizing the unique needs of students, we introduced the AxCrypt Student Plan last year. Designed specifically for academic life, this plan offers an ideal blend of affordability and premium features to protect your research, assignments, and personal projects.

data.name: Blog_ANYANEFSWA_H1_Text2
data.value: • Enhanced Business Security with Group Feature

data.name: Blog_ANYANEFSWA_H1_Text3
data.value: AxCrypt’s Group Feature is a breakthrough in simplifying secure collaboration for businesses. It empowers organizations to set up departmental groups for managing users, restricting file access, and controlling encryption keys at a granular level. This innovation has streamlined workflows, strengthened team efficiency, and elevated data security standards.

data.name: Blog_ANYANEFSWA_H1_Text4
data.value: • Centralized Security with the Group Masterkey

data.name: Blog_ANYANEFSWA_H1_Text5
data.value: With the Group Masterkey, we’ve made security simpler and stronger. By reducing the need for individual passwords, we ensure that only authorized people can access your encrypted data. It works seamlessly with role-based access, so Group Admins can easily manage access. This streamlined key management system helps improve efficiency, security, and compliance for your organization.

data.name: Blog_ANYANEFSWA_H1_Text6
data.value: • Breaking Language Barriers with Multilingual Support

data.name: Blog_ANYANEFSWA_H1_Text7
data.value: AxCrypt continued its mission to make security accessible to everyone. In 2024, we expanded our support to over 14 languages, ensuring that users from all corners of the world can manage their files in the language they know best. Whether you’re working in Mandarin, French, or Spanish, AxCrypt is here to make your experience smoother.

data.name: Blog_ANYANEFSWA_H1_Text8
data.value: • Encryption on the Go: Mobile Made Easy

data.name: Blog_ANYANEFSWA_H1_Text9
data.value: Securing your files shouldn’t mean staying tied to your desk. In 2024, mobile encryption grew even more popular, letting users encrypt and decrypt files with just a few taps. Whether you’re travelling or working remotely, AxCrypt brought security right to your fingertips.

data.name: Blog_ANYANEFSWA_H2_Text1
data.value: AxCrypt continues to set the standard in encryption. For the 9th consecutive year, we proudly earned the title of Best Encryption Software by PCMag.

data.name: Blog_ANYANEFSWA_H4_Text1
data.value: The stats from 2024 are sobering: an average of 1,673 cyberattacks per organization each week, marking a 44% increase from the previous year. It’s a stark reminder of the evolving threats we all face in the digital world.

data.name: Blog_ANYANEFSWA_H4_Text2
data.value: But 2025 offers a chance to rewrite the narrative. By adopting proactive measures like encryption, you can protect your data and ensure you’re not caught off guard. AxCrypt is here to empower you with the tools and confidence you need to stay secure. Don’t let the mistakes of the past define your future; take charge of your digital safety with AxCrypt.
