data.value: Welcome to 2025. This year marks a critical turning point in the world of cybersecurity as we prepare for emerging threats and groundbreaking trends. From the latest malware to potential cyber wars, the next 12 months could bring significant challenges to the global cyber community.

data.name: Blog_ANYANEFSWA_Text1
data.value: Welcome to 2025. This year marks a critical turning point in the world of cybersecurity as we prepare for emerging threats and groundbreaking trends. From the latest malware to potential cyber wars, the next 12 months could bring significant challenges to the global cyber community.

data.name: Blog_ANYANEFSWA_Text2
data.value: However, every problem has a solution. AxCrypt stands as your best defense against these evolving threats. If you believe you're safe because you're not running a large business or have minimal online connections, think again. Cyberattacks can target anyone, anywhere, at any time.

data.name: Blog_ANYANEFSWA_Text3
data.value: Encryption scrambles your data into unreadable codes, making it nearly impossible for unauthorized entities to access your information. AxCrypt has been at the forefront of promoting encryption and raising awareness because your privacy matters.

data.name: Blog_ANYANEFSWA_Title
data.value: A New Year, a New Era of File Security with AxCrypt

data.name: Blog_AOVO_H2_Text1
data.value: We store what we call an AxCrypt ID which is associated with your account on our servers. (Technically this is an RSA-4096 encryption key pair.) This key pair consists of a public sharing and private secret part. When we encrypt a file we don’t really encrypt it with your password as the encryption key. We encrypt your file with a random and unique key every time a file is encrypted. We call this the master file key. It’s this master file key that we actually encrypt with your password and add to the encrypted file. We also encrypt this same master file key with your public sharing key from your AxCrypt ID, as well as the public sharing keys of any additional recipients you may have added with the key sharing feature.

data.name: Blog_AOVO_H2_Text10
data.value: • Any private secret key corresponding to a public sharing key used to encrypt the master file key as described above.

data.name: Blog_AOVO_H2_Text11
data.value: On the AxCrypt server, we store yours and everyone else’s AxCrypt IDs which consists of the public sharing key, and your private secret key – encrypted as an AxCrypt file using only your password to encrypt the master file key for that file.

data.name: Blog_AOVO_H2_Text12
data.value: Finally, we can tell you what the server is used for!

data.name: Blog_AOVO_H2_Text13
data.value:
1. To make public sharing keys available to anyone who would potentially want to make encrypted data available to someone else.
  2. To keep a backup of your encrypted private secret key, so if you buy a new device or need to reinstall AxCrypt you can get it back to your device.
  3. To enable global password change for you. If you change your password on our server, we’ll re-encrypt your private key there with the new password and this means that all your already encrypted files will now be decryptable with the new password! Very convenient. You can still also decrypt them with the original password used when the file was encrypted of course.

data.name: Blog_AOVO_H2_Text2
data.value: An AxCrypt-encrypted file consists of the following:

data.name: Blog_AOVO_H2_Text3
data.value: • The original file encrypted with AES-128/256 using a random unique master file key.

data.name: Blog_AOVO_H2_Text4
data.value: • The master file key, encrypted with your password.

data.name: Blog_AOVO_H2_Text5
data.value: • The master file key, encrypted with your public sharing key.

data.name: Blog_AOVO_H2_Text6
data.value: • The master file key, optionally encrypted with other recipients public sharing keys.

data.name: Blog_AOVO_H2_Text7
data.value: The unique thing about public sharing and private secret key pairs is that while anyone can *encrypt* data with the public sharing key, only the person knowing the private secret part can *decrypt*, and even knowing the public sharing key it’s not possible to figure out the private secret key.

data.name: Blog_AOVO_H2_Text8
data.value: To decrypt an AxCrypt-encrypted file, you need to have either of:

data.name: Blog_AOVO_H2_Text9
data.value: • The original password, to decrypt the master file key.

data.name: Blog_AOVO_H3_Text1
data.value: There’s also an online password manager, where we can keep track of all of your passwords encrypted with your AxCrypt password. One password to rule them all ;-) This is such a common use of AxCrypt, to encrypt a file with a list of passwords, we thought we could make this even easier.

data.name: Blog_AOVO_H4_Text1
data.value: Since some of the features of AxCrypt are reserved for paying Premium users, we need to know if you have a valid Premium subscription. To avoid various hacks used by offline software licensing technologies, we keep it simple and secure and keep track of payment status on our server. This is fairly standard procedure.

data.name: Blog_AOVO_Summary
data.value: AxCrypt Online vs. Offline There’s some concern about the fact that AxCrypt is able to connect to the Internet. Do I need to be online to encrypt or decrypt my files with AxCrypt? Is my data sent over the Internet in any form?

data.name: Blog_AOVO_Text1
data.value: There’s some concern about the fact that AxCrypt is able to connect to the Internet.

data.name: Blog_AOVO_Text2
data.value:
1. Do I need to be online to encrypt or decrypt my files with AxCrypt?
  2. Is my data sent over the Internet in any form?
  3. Why does AxCrypt need to be online at all?

data.name: Blog_AOVO_Text3
data.value: The first two are easy enough to answer.

data.name: Blog_AOVO_Text4
data.value: • No, AxCrypt does not need to be online to install or operate.

data.name: Blog_AOVO_Text5
data.value: • No, your data never leaves your computer – unless it resides there in the first place of course.

data.name: Blog_AOVO_Text6
data.value: AxCrypt will automatically switch to ‘offline’ mode if it’s not possible to connect to the server. It can also be started with the –offline command line switch, or set permanently offline by using the “File | Options | Always Offline” option.

data.name: Blog_AOVO_Title

data.name: Blog_ARWMBBGDM_H1_Text1

data.value: With an overall rating of 4.9/5 and 20+ reviews across Gartner Digital Markets brands, AxCrypt continues to be a reliable choice for those seeking:

data.value: • Simplified encryption to protect sensitive files.

data.name: Blog_ARWMBBGDM_H2_Text4
data.value: • User-friendly features for both individuals and businesses.

data.value: • Mobile Application to encrypt and decrypt files on the go.

data.name: Blog_ARWMBBGDM_H2_Text6
data.value: • Group-level key management for admins and user groups within businesses.

data.name: Blog_ARWMBBGDM_H2_Text7
data.value: • Secure password management for safely sharing and storing passwords.

data.value: While 2024 has been a year of remarkable milestones, we are excited to embark on the journey ahead. AxCrypt remains committed to enhancing our software and introducing innovative features that address evolving security needs.

data.value: In 2025, you can expect:

data.name: Blog_ARWMBBGDM_H3_Text5

data.name: Blog_ARWMBBGDM_H3_Text6
data.value: We’re grateful for the trust and support of our customers, which fuels our growth and innovation.

data.value: We value your feedback! If AxCrypt has made a difference for you or your organization, share your review with us here.

data.name: Blog_ARWMBBGDM_H5_Text1
data.value: AxCrypt is an award-winning encryption software company specializing in secure file encryption, password management, and cloud security solutions. Our mission is to simplify security for individuals and businesses, empowering them to protect their sensitive data effortlessly.

Through localized sites like Capterra, GetApp, and Software Advice, it connects users to verified reviews and objective research, enabling confident decision-making.

data.name: Blog_ARWMBBGDM_Text3

𝘈𝘴 𝘸𝘦 𝘤𝘰𝘯𝘵𝘪𝘯𝘶𝘦 𝘵𝘰 𝘦𝘷𝘰𝘭𝘷𝘦, 𝘸𝘦 𝘳𝘦𝘮𝘢𝘪𝘯 𝘧𝘰𝘤𝘶𝘴𝘦𝘥 𝘰𝘯 𝘥𝘦𝘭𝘪𝘷𝘦𝘳𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘱𝘰𝘸𝘦𝘳𝘧𝘶𝘭, 𝘪𝘯𝘵𝘶𝘪𝘵𝘪𝘷𝘦 𝘵𝘰𝘰𝘭𝘴 𝘵𝘩𝘢𝘵 𝘦𝘯𝘴𝘶𝘳𝘦 𝘰𝘶𝘳 𝘶𝘴𝘦𝘳𝘴’ 𝘥𝘢𝘵𝘢 𝘪𝘴 𝘱𝘳𝘰𝘵𝘦𝘤𝘵𝘦𝘥 𝘸𝘪𝘵𝘩 𝘢𝘥𝘷𝘢𝘯𝘤𝘦𝘥 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘱𝘳𝘰𝘷𝘦𝘯 𝘦𝘯𝘤𝘳𝘺𝘱𝘵𝘪𝘰𝘯 𝘵𝘦𝘤𝘩𝘯𝘰𝘭𝘰𝘨𝘺. data.name: Blog_ASTSHSA_Conclusion
data.value: The holiday season is a time for celebration and spending time with loved ones, but it's also important to make sure that your data is safe and secure. By following these tips and using a reputable security solution like AxCrypt, you can help protect your data from unauthorized access and give yourself peace of mind. Happy holidays!

data.name: Blog_ASTSHSA_H1_Text1
data.value: Choosing strong, unique passwords is one of the easiest ways to protect your accounts and data. Make sure to use a combination of letters, numbers, and special characters, and avoid using personal information or dictionary words. Still the most common password is still â€œ123456â€, so it's important to be creative and not use easily guessable passwords. It's also a good idea to use different passwords for different accounts to reduce the risk of all of your accounts being compromised if one password is exposed.

data.name: Blog_ASTSHSA_H2_Text2
data.value: A password manager is a tool that generates and stores strong, unique passwords, helps you avoid using weak passwords, and makes it easier to use different passwords for different accounts. It also securely stores and organizes your passwords and may offer additional features such as two-factor authentication and alerts for exposed passwords. A password manager is a convenient and secure way to manage passwords. One option is AxCrypt which offers a password manager as part of its security solution.

data.name: Blog_ASTSHSA_H3_Text3
data.value: It's important to keep your software and operating system up to date to ensure that you have the latest security fixes. Hackers often target outdated systems, so make sure to regularly check for updates and install them when they are available. This includes your operating system, as well as any software that you use, such as your web browser, antivirus program, and office suite.

data.name: Blog_ASTSHSA_H4_Text4
data.value: Consider using a security solution like AxCrypt to encrypt your files and protect them with a password. This can help prevent unauthorized access to your data and give you peace of mind. Encrypting your files ensures that even if someone gains access to them, they will not be able to read or use the data without the password.

data.name: Blog_ASTSHSA_H5_Text5
data.value: Accidents happen, and it's always a good idea to have a backup of your important files. Make sure to regularly back up your data to a secure location, such as an external hard drive or a cloud storage service. This can help protect against data loss in the event of a system failure or other unforeseen event. It's also a good idea to test your backups regularly to ensure that they are working properly.

data.name: Blog_ASTSHSA_H6_Text6
data.value: Public Wi-Fi networks can be vulnerable to hackers, so it's best to avoid accessing sensitive information or logging into important accounts while using them. If you need to use public Wi-Fi, make sure to use a reputable VPN service to secure your connection. A VPN, or virtual private network, encrypts your internet connection and helps protect your data from being accessed by others on the same network.

data.name: Blog_ASTSHSA_H7_Text7
data.value: During the holiday season, scammers often try to take advantage of people's generosity and good cheer. Be cautious when opening emails or clicking on links from unfamiliar sources, as these can be used to trick you into revealing sensitive information or downloading.

data.name: Blog_ASTSHSA_Heading1
data.value: 1. Use strong, unique passwords

data.name: Blog_ASTSHSA_Heading2
data.value: 2. Use a password manager

data.name: Blog_ASTSHSA_Heading3
data.value: 3. Keep your software and operating system up to date

data.name: Blog_ASTSHSA_Heading4
data.value: 4. Use a reputable security solution

data.name: Blog_ASTSHSA_Heading5
data.value: 5. Back up your data

data.name: Blog_ASTSHSA_Heading6
data.value: 6. Be cautious when using public Wi-Fi

data.name: Blog_ASTSHSA_Heading7
data.value: 7. Be mindful of phishing scams

data.name: Blog_ASTSHSA_Summary
data.value: It's important to make sure that your data is safe and secure. With the increase in online shopping and the exchange of sensitive information, it's more important than ever to take steps to protect your data.

data.name: Blog_ASTSHSA_Title
data.value: A few secret tips to keep your data safe during the holiday season with AxCrypt

data.name: Blog_BAFESFW_Conclusion_Text1
data.value: AxCrypt is an award winning encryption software available across all platforms including PC, Mac, iOS, and Android. For six years in a row, AxCrypt has consistently been awarded as the “World's Best Encryption Software” by PC Mag since 2016.

data.name: Blog_BAFESFW_Conclusion_Text2
data.value: When it comes to finding a trustworthy and versatile automatic encryption software for Windows and other platforms, AxCrypt is the ultimate solution. It is your perfect choice to encrypt files on your Windows PC, both professionally and personally.

data.name: Blog_BAFESFW_Conclusion_Text3
data.value: AxCrypt utilizes the superior AES 256-bit algorithm to protect your sensitive files, your personal photos and videos, and your business documents. It also comes with several unique features such as automatic cloud encryption, secure file sharing, password management and generation, and a master key feature to manage administrative encryption and decrypt subordinate accounts.

data.name: Blog_BAFESFW_Conclusion_Text4
data.value: Try AxCrypt for free today with a 30-day free trial, and take your data security to the next level. Sign up now https://account.axcrypt.net/en/Home/Login?Signup=True

data.name: Blog_BAFESFW_H1_SubHeading1
data.value: Steps on How to Encrypt Files on Your Windows

data.name: Blog_BAFESFW_H1_Text1
data.value: File encryption is a process where individual files are secured by a file encryption software, by scrambling and rearranging the file’s data. This makes the file unreadable and inaccessible to unauthorized parties, without the appropriate decryption key.

data.name: Blog_BAFESFW_H1_Text2
data.value: During the process, the encryption software runs the files through a strong encryption algorithm such as AES,which uses complex mathematical operations to scramble and rearrange the contents of the files. The scrambling process may involve several intricate operations such as substitution (replacement) of text, permutation (shuffling), and bitwise logical operations such as XOR and shifting.

data.name: Blog_BAFESFW_H1_Text3
data.value: Depending on the algorithm, the operations can run for several rounds based on the round-key size. AES utilizes 10, 12, or 14 rounds based on the chosen key size. Each round applies and reiterates a series of operations to further obfuscate the file's data, enhancing its security.

data.name: Blog_BAFESFW_H1_Text4
data.value: When you encrypt a file, the encryption software generates a unique encryption key, which serves as the secret code needed to unlock and decrypt the file. This key is typically derived from a password or passphrase that you choose during the encryption process.

data.name: Blog_BAFESFW_H1_Text5
data.value: Once your files are encrypted, they can be safely stored, shared, or transmitted without the fear of unauthorized access. Even if someone gains access to your encrypted files, they will be unable to decipher the content without the encryption key.

data.name: Blog_BAFESFW_H1_Text6
data.value: Automatic file encryption takes the process a step further by eliminating the need for manual encryption each time you create or modify a file. With the help of AxCrypt, you can set up automatic encryption rules that apply encryption to specific folders or subfolders. This means that any new files or modifications made to the designated folders will be automatically encrypted, providing continuous protection without any extra effort on your part while you continue to work on the file.

data.name: Blog_BAFESFW_H2_SH2_Text1
data.value: • ⏰ Time and Effort Saving: By setting up automatic encryption rules, you eliminate the need to manually encrypt each file. This saves you valuable time and effort, especially when dealing with a large number of files or frequent modifications.

data.name: Blog_BAFESFW_H2_SH2_Text2
data.value: • 📂 Simplified File Management: AxCrypt's automatic encryption feature simplifies file management by applying encryption to specific folders or subfolders. This ensures that all files within the designated folders are automatically encrypted, reducing the risk of human error or accidental exposure.

data.name: Blog_BAFESFW_H2_SH2_Text3
data.value: • 🔒 Enhanced Data Security: Automatic encryption ensures that your sensitive files are protected from unauthorized access. By encrypting them, you add an extra layer of security, safeguarding your data even if it falls into the wrong hands.

data.name: Blog_BAFESFW_H2_SH2_Text4
data.value: • 📝 Compliance with Data Protection Regulations: Automatic file encryption with AxCrypt helps you meet data protection regulations and compliance requirements. Encrypting sensitive data ensures that you adhere to privacy laws and industry regulations, providing peace of mind and mitigating legal risks.

data.name: Blog_BAFESFW_H2_SubHeading2
data.value: • 🔄 Seamless Workflow: With automatic encryption, you can continue working on encrypted files without any disruption. AxCrypt allows you to open and work on encrypted files just as easily as you would on regular files, making the encryption process seamless and hassle-free.

data.name: Blog_BAFESFW_H2_Text1
data.value: Now that you know how to automatically encrypt files on your with AxCryptâ€™s Encryption Software, letâ€™s look at some of the key benefits of automatically encrypting files on your Windows PC with the strong AES 256-Bit algorithm.

The AES 256-Bit encryption algorithm employed by AxCrypt guarantees the highest level of encryption strength and protection for your sensitive data and business files.

data.name: Blog_BAWIT_Conclusion
data.value: The issue of women in tech and gender diversity at workplace requires a progressive approach, with an effort and inclusion of everyone. AxCrypt strives for a strong gender diverse workplace and welcomes and appreciates different women who bring their own unique contribution and working styles for the womanhood. Let’s celebrate this woman’s day as a thank you to all the women working in tech, who are putting their efforts to bring gender diversity at workplace, one step at a time.

data.name: Blog_BAWIT_H1_Text1
data.value: “Being a women in tech gives me a sense of freedom and confidence. I feel proud to be breaking the gender stereotypes about the traditional roles of women and instead becoming more educated and familiar with technology. This has enabled me to become self-sufficient, reliable, and adaptive – when facing different life challenges and situations.

data.name: Blog_BAWIT_H1_Text2
data.value: One of the best things about working in the technology sector is the slew of opportunities and possibilities that are presented to you. It allows you to become more flexible and open-minded, while still having an innate curiosity, and the ability to change, adapt, and educate yourself. It makes you grow both professionally and personally, and helps you live a content and purposeful life.”

data.name: Blog_BAWIT_H2_Text1
data.value: “Working in the constantly evolving tech industry has made me feel young and full of energy. At AxCrypt, not only do I find fulfilment in my career, but I’m also able to financially support my partner and appreciate the challenges that come with his own job. We mutually complement each other, both in our professional and personal lives, and my parents couldn’t be happier seeing their daughter pursue a career in tech after starting a family.”

data.name: Blog_BAWIT_H2_Text2
data.value: Overall, inspiring more women to pursue careers in technology requires a concerted effort from individuals, companies, and society as a whole. By breaking down barriers and promoting inclusivity, we can create a more diverse and innovative tech industry that thrives on the collective efforts of everyone.”

data.name: Blog_BAWIT_H3_Text1
data.value: “I have been working in the tech industry for the past 20 years – specifically, in the administrative and human resources side of the industry. This is not a job I could have dreamed of as a child, and the tech world didn’t even exist back then. Bangalore used to be a beautiful tourist destination, until the early 2000s when almost overnight it became the IT hub of India

data.name: Blog_BAWIT_H3_Text2
data.value: This was also around the time I was starting out in life in Bangalore was very privileged to be able to grow in the industry while it was still in its early stages. I have had the opportunity to see, learn, and participate on what it takes to build multiple international tech companies from the ground up. Throughout my career, I've made life-long friends from various parts of the world, acquainted myself with diverse cultures, and was even fortunate enough to travel abroad for work.

data.name: Blog_BAWIT_H3_Text3
data.value: In the tech industry, there is always something new to learn and ample room for personal and professional growth. Moreover, there is enormous potential to be creative and make a positive impact. For me, working at AxCrypt is the best job ever, and I especially cherish the opportunity it provides.

data.name: Blog_BAWIT_H3_Text4
data.value: At AxCrypt, I have the freedom to grow in my role without any limits, and the upper management has fostered a work environment that is friendly yet competitive. What I value most about this workplace is the sense of equality and respect that is deeply ingrained in its culture.”

data.name: Blog_BAWIT_H4_Text1
data.value: “Technology is linked with progress, and a community that embraces technology is considered to be progressive. Technology simplifies our lives and improves our standard of living.

data.name: Blog_BAWIT_H4_Text2
data.value: As someone who works in the technology industry, I feel that I’m playing a key role in the progress of my community and making people's lives better. While I may not be directly involved in the development of the technology itself; my efforts, experience, and knowledge has helped make it more accessible to the people and processes of it simplified.

data.name: Blog_BAWIT_H4_Text3
data.value: Working at AxCrypt has given me the opportunity to contribute to the betterment of people using technology, and as a women in tech, I’m committed to ensuring that technology reaches everyone and helps enhance individuals' lives, ultimately contributing to the development of society.”

data.name: Blog_BAWIT_H5_Text1
data.value: “The technology field demands more dedication and hard work, as we work to bring the abstract and creative ideas to life on screens. It allows us to express ourselves and find solutions to every problem. Technology is like an endless sea of possibilities, where there is always something new to learn, and it empowers us to see beyond the horizon. Whether we are men or women, it is our choice to ride the beautiful waves of technology and explore the depths of knowledge.

data.name: Blog_BAWIT_H5_Text2
data.value: The tech field provides a higher level of understanding and practical knowledge, helping us to organize our lives and approach them with optimism and wisdom. We deserve access to knowledge and awareness of the protection technology can offer us. As women, we understand that opportunities may not always come our way, but we have the power to create them ourselves.”

data.name: Blog_BAWIT_H6_Text1
data.value: “The field of information technology has traditionally been a male dominated one, but I see every day that more and more women are breaking into the industry and making a name for themselves. Balancing my work and personal life may be a challenge, but with every challenge comes the opportunity to grow and become stronger. In this ever-evolving industry, it is vital to stay up-to-date with the latest trends and skills. Falling behind the curve can mean losing out in the highly competitive world of tech.

data.name: Blog_BAWIT_H6_Text2
data.value: As a women in tech, I am constantly learning and expanding my skills to stay ahead of the curve. The tech industry offers endless possibilities for innovation and making a positive impact on the world. It's a challenging yet dynamic career path that is worth every bit of effort.

data.name: Blog_BAWIT_H6_Text3
data.value: I am proud to be a part of an industry that is shaping the future and changing the world for the better. Thank you for giving me the opportunity to share my experience in the tech industry.”

data.name: Blog_BAWIT_H7_Text1
data.value: “The myth that women's empowerment can only happen slowly has debilitated their power. We need to realize that, when it comes to eradicating this deep-rooted problem of traditional gender stereotyping, everyone's contribution counts.

data.name: Blog_BAWIT_H7_Text2
data.value: Faced with several hurdles such as gender preferences, low representation and a virtual glass ceiling, women are constantly trying to uplift themselves and bring a change in the industry, and are excelling in higher positions. Despite the challenges, it is a fulfilling experience to work in a company that doesn't discriminate. I am glad to work as a women in the IT industry and have high hopes for breaking gender inequality. Happy International Women's Day.”

data.name: Blog_BAWIT_H8_Text1
data.value: “I am a software engineer with over 10 years of experience in .NET development, and I’m proud to be part of the tech industry. I entered the corporate world through campus recruitment, and was offered a position at one of the big IT companies, and it was a dream come true.

data.name: Blog_BAWIT_H8_Text2
data.value: Despite challenges and stereotypes about women's capabilities in coding and analytical thinking, I have persevered and have seen the importance of diversity in this field. Balancing work and family responsibilities can be difficult, especially for working mothers, but we are capable of multitasking, time management, and keeping up with family values while pursuing our careers.

data.name: Blog_BAWIT_H8_Text3
data.value: As Women's Day approaches, I would like to extend my congratulations to all the women in tech and thank them for their remarkable achievements and contribution to the industry.

data.name: Blog_BESFBDTUG_H1_Text1
data.value: Encryption is a process that protects your sensitive business data and individual files by transforming the contents of the files into unreadable format, using complex algorithms. This ensures that even if unauthorized individuals gain access to your data, they won't be able to understand or exploit it.

data.name: Blog_BESFBDTUG_H1_Text10
data.value: • 👥 Secure Collaboration: Encrypted files enable safe collaboration and sharing, restricting access to authorized individuals.

data.name: Blog_BESFBDTUG_H1_Text11
data.value: • 🛡️ Data Breach Shield: Encryption reduces the risk of data breaches by rendering the stolen or compromised data unreadable to cyber attackers. Even if a breach occurs, encrypted data is essentially useless to attackers, helping to mitigate potential damage and avoid financial consequences.

data.name: Blog_BESFBDTUG_H1_Text2
data.value: The encryption process essentially involves three key components to encrypt data:

data.name: Blog_BESFBDTUG_H1_Text3
data.value: • The plaintext, which refers to the original unencrypted data or file.

data.name: Blog_BESFBDTUG_H1_Text4
data.value: • An encryption algorithm like AES, which uses complex mathematical functions to rearrange and jumble the contents of the original file or data.

data.name: Blog_BESFBDTUG_H1_Text5
data.value: • Cryptographic keys, which are unique keys with specific patterns used to encrypt and decrypt files. These keys enable the encryption process to be reversed, allowing authorized individuals to read the data. Think of them as the unique keys for your house or car door.

data.name: Blog_BESFBDTUG_H1_Text6
data.value: Once the files are encrypted, users can decrypt them with a specified decryption key that is tied to the particular file. Users can then view, edit, and modify those files, and re-encrypt them after the modification process.

data.name: Blog_BESFBDTUG_H1_Text7
data.value: Encrypting your business data offers several core benefits that can provide peace of mind and ensure a business’s security is at the priority:

data.name: Blog_BESFBDTUG_H1_Text8
data.value: • 🔄 Seamless Workflows: Automatic encryption streamlines workflows by automatically securing new and modified files. Employees can work on encrypted files without disruptions, enhancing productivity and data security.

data.name: Blog_BESFBDTUG_H1_Text9
data.value: • ✅ Compliance with Regulations: Encryption helps meet data protection requirements across different regulations and ensures legal compliance.

data.name: Blog_BESFBDTUG_H2_Text1
data.value: AxCrypt deploys the powerful AES-256 encryption algorithm to encrypt and secure business data. It can encrypt files on various devices, such as desktops, laptops, smartphones, and on cloud services like OneDrive and Google Drive.

data.name: Blog_BESFBDTUG_H2_Text13
data.value: With AxCrypt's Master Key feature, employers and managers can easily manage individual licenses and access encrypted accounts with a single click. The Master Key can decrypt any encrypted file within subordinate accounts and provides the ability to limit or revoke access to those accounts. This ensures that files can be decrypted in cases of key loss, employee departure, or credential loss.

data.name: Blog_BESFBDTUG_H2_Text14
data.value: For example, let's consider a scenario where the yearly revenue report, created by the previous financial team, was encrypted with credentials that are now unavailable to the new team. The new financial team could not access the report when they needed it for the annual analysis.

data.name: Blog_BESFBDTUG_H2_Text15
data.value: This is where the Master Key feature comes to the rescue. With the Master Key, authorized personnel or administrators can regain access to encrypted files, even if the original credentials are no longer available.

data.name: Blog_BESFBDTUG_H2_Text16
data.value: It provides a centralized management capability, allowing for the decryption of files within subordinate accounts and the ability to control access permissions. This ensures that essential documents can be decrypted and accessed when needed, despite changes in team members or credentials.

data.name: Blog_BESFBDTUG_H2_Text17
data.value: Businesses can leverage AxCrypt’s Master Key functionality to gain control over their encrypted files and prevent any potential data access roadblocks caused by personnel changes or lost credentials. This adds an extra layer of flexibility to the encryption process.

data.name: Blog_BESFBDTUG_H2_Text18

Businesses can also enable automatic encryption for files on cloud services, and ensure a comprehensive data protection mechanism across devices.

data.name: Blog_BESFBDTUG_Summary
data.value: Encrypting sensitive data and crucial business files is one of the most important steps a company or an organization can take to safeguard itself from expensive data breaches, data leaks caused by human errors, malware, and large-scale cyber attacks.

data.name: Blog_BESFBDTUG_Text1
data.value: Encrypting sensitive data and crucial business files is one of the most important steps a company or an organization can take to safeguard itself from expensive data breaches, data leaks caused by human errors, malware, and large-scale cyber attacks.

data.name: Blog_BESFBDTUG_Text2
data.value: According to the Verizon’s Data Breach Investigations Report (DBIR) 2022, a staggering 82% of the data breaches involved some form of human element. This means that 8 out of 10 data breaches were caused by human errors, including susceptible phishing attacks, accidental emailing, and social engineering.

data.name: Blog_BESFBDTUG_Text3
data.value: Small and medium-sized businesses (SMBs) and enterprises are particularly vulnerable to cyber threats. Small businesses account for over 42% of all data breaches, and an alarming 60% of small businesses shut downwithin 6 months of a cyber attack. It becomes beyond imperative for businesses to prioritize the security of their sensitive data with proven cybersecurity practices.

data.name: Blog_BESFBDTUG_Text4
data.value: With the usage of powerful encryption techniques, such as using the AES-256 encryption algorithm, even if your business's data is breached and leaked, it will be unreadable to unauthorized individuals. This makes it significantly more difficult for cybercriminals to exploit your data and inflict harm on your business.

data.value: With a password manager, you may simply and safely share passwords and notes with anyone especially when some sensitive information shouldn't be sent by SMS. Managing who has access to which accounts can be difficult for many firms, especially when numerous personnel require access to a single account. You may effectively manage and modify the password with the aid of a password manager.

data.name: Blog_BMYP_H1_SH2_Text1
data.value: The fact that you don't need to have an excellent memory is the real advantage of using a password manager to increase your online security. This implies that everyone can apply the most recent password security advice.

data.name: Blog_BMYP_H1_SH3_Text1
data.value: People would like not having to remember long passwords that include symbols, numbers, punctuation, and capital letters, as well as other security password requirements. Additionally, they are permitted to employ complex passwords that are unique for each access point.

data.name: Blog_BMYP_H1_SH4_Text1
data.value: Password managers enable users to type, remember, and have the username and password for every access point filled in automatically. It lets you get right to the most crucial things without wasting time by saving you time that you might otherwise spend trying to remember your passwords or even searching through your diary to find them.

data.name: Blog_BMYP_H1_SH5_Text1
data.value: Password security alone is only one aspect of managing your passwords. Credit card data is accessible securely, and cryptocurrency wallets are likewise secured. Your money is protected from theft by safeguarding the information associated with your bank account and Coinbase account. You would need to secure your money with a password manager that allows you to access it from anywhere in the globe if you can't afford to lose it all.

data.name: Blog_BMYP_Text1
data.value: Security concerns are frequently of the utmost importance in an age where cybercrime is the most prevalent vice. People from many walks of life are working hard to discover solutions that not only offer the finest protection but also easy-to-use techniques in response to data breaches and other concerns. Despite repeated recommendations against using overly simple passwords or recycling the same password, a recent Pew Research Center survey found that people are still at risk of damaging personal data breaches that could result in identity or financial theft due to poor password management and a lack of digital security practices.

data.name: Blog_BMYP_Text2
data.value: The majority of people have confirmed that they frequently use passwords that are identical to or strikingly similar to one another. Others acknowledge employing short, uncomplicated passwords that are simple to remember. The best way to remember passwords is to memorize them, followed by the conventional pen and paper method of noting essential things in the diary. Simple passwords or even ones that are similar can be quickly guessed, and writing them down in a journal makes things worse because they can be easily stolen. One of Axcrypt's key features, a password manager, may be the solution to your cyber security worries.

data.name: Blog_BMYP_Title
data.value: Benefits Of Managing Your Passwords

data.name: Blog_BSOHDGE_H1_Text1
data.value: Encryption is a technique that transforms plain text into an unreadable form called ciphertext. This is achieved by running the text through an encryption algorithm, like AES, which randomly rearranges and jumbles up the content, rendering it incomprehensible during transmission.

data.name: Blog_BSOHDGE_H1_Text2
data.value: The process of rearranging the text is supported by complex mathematical calculations referred to as a ‘key.’ These same mathematical calculations are also used for decryption, which reverses the encryption process and permits only authorized individuals to access the original plain text.

data.name: Blog_BSOHDGE_H2_Text1
data.value: Encryption utilizes intricate mathematical procedures called 'encryption algorithms' along with digital keys to scramble data. These encryption keys can be produced either manually or by software that applies an algorithm to scramble data and create a unique encryption key.

data.name: Blog_BSOHDGE_H2_Text2
data.value: Scrambling of the text occurs by encryption algorithm (cipher), when it uses the encryption key to apply the conversion of data based on the mathematical equations of key, to turn it into ciphertext. This ciphertext can then be transmitted to a recipient and decoded back into the original value using the same or different cipher and key.

data.name: Blog_BSOHDGE_H2_Text3
data.value: This is a very important element in terms of data security, as it guarantees that no one else would be able to read or decipher your data during its transmission – ensuring privacy and security of the sensitive information.

data.name: Blog_BSOHDGE_H2_Text4
data.value: A rudimentary encryption technique involves swapping each letter with its opposite position in the alphabet, such as “a” is replaced with “z”, and “b” with “y” and so on. An example of this is the phrase “AxCrypt Software” resulting in an encrypted string using the letter-swapping technique as “ZwBqxos Rnesvzqd”.

data.name: Blog_BSOHDGE_H3_Text1
data.value: Encryption has emerged as one of the most powerful tools to safeguard important and sensitive information from malicious actors. As the number and sophistication of cyberattacks continue to rise every day along with the enormous amount of data being generated globally, the role of data encryption becomes more critical than ever before.

data.name: Blog_BSOHDGE_H3_Text2
data.value: Businesses and individuals can use encryption and prioritize encryption to keep their systems and data secure. Even if attackers manage to gain access to sensitive information, encryption renders it useless to them without the corresponding decryption key. This makes it nearly impossible for them to read or use the data, ensuring that it remains confidential and protected.

data.name: Blog_BSOHDGE_H4_Conclusion
data.value: Overall, AxCrypt provides a secure solution for encrypting files on local and cloud storage using AES 256-Bit encryption. It is super easy to use on desktops, laptops, and mobile devices, making it convenient to safeguard sensitive data from anywhere. AxCrypt also allows users to take advantage of the convenience of cloud storage while ensuring that their data remains confidential and secure anywhere around the world.

data.value: Try it out today with a free trial and take your data security to the next level. Sign up now at [SIGNUP LINK] , [LANDING PAGE LINK]

The software provides strong encryption using the AES 256-Bit, ensuring that data remains protected from unauthorized access. Users can simply select the files they wish to encrypt and AxCrypt will automatically apply the encryption process, making it easy to use for those who may not be familiar with encryption.

data.name: Blog_BSOHDGE_H4_Text2
data.value: AxCrypt also offers secure file sharing, allowing users to send encrypted files to others via email or cloud storage services such as Dropbox or Google Drive. Recipients can then easily decrypt the files using their own AxCrypt software, making it a convenient and secure way to share sensitive information.

data.name: Blog_BSOHDGE_H4_Text3
data.value: AxCrypt also includes a password management feature, which enables users to securely store their passwords in an encrypted file, adding an extra layer of protection to their sensitive information. Overall, AxCrypt is a user-friendly and reliable option for encrypting data across multiple devices.

data.value: With the advent of Industry 4.0 and technologies like AI and ML, it has become even more important to safeguard your sensitive data. According to a World Economic Forum (WRF) report, by 2025, the amount of data generated in the cloud servers each day will reach around 463 exabytes globally. This is an astonishingly enormous amount data generated within just a day, which also increases the chances of data attacks and data breaches.

data.name: Blog_BSOHDGE_Text2
data.value: In light of these figures, it's essential for businesses to prioritize the safety of their data, particularly from breaches and cyberattacks. One popular and effective method to ensure data safety is encryption, which is widely used across various online activities like online banking, email, and online shopping, and is even being used as we read this article.

data.name: Blog_BSOHDGE_Text3
data.value: Let’s dive deeper with the following topics and understand the ‘behind-the-scenes’ of encryption, what is it, how it works, and why it should be an essential element of your business – all in a simpler, easy-to-grasp language:

data.name: Blog_BSTSSCE_H1_SH1_Text1
data.value: Use a virtual private network (VPN). VPNs are used to protect private web traffic from snooping, interference, and censorship. PNs encrypt all the data you send over the internet. Your VPN also masks your IP address and finally some VPNs block malicious websites, ads, and trackers.

data.name: Blog_BSTSSCE_H1_SH2_Text1
data.value: Strong passwords are the key to your digital life. Passwords are the digital keys to our networks of friends, our work colleagues, and even our banking and payment services. The most important two passwords are those for your email and social network accounts. It’s important to use entirely new and unique passwords for each account you might run, so you avoid compromising your data if one of your accounts gets hacked. To have a strong password it is extremely important not to include any personal information in your passwords. Hackers could attempt to log on to your account by guessing your password based off of personal information gained from your security questions. The shorter and less complex your password is, the quicker it can be to come up with the correct combination of characters and access your private information. A password cracker is a programme using a multitude of combinations in a very small amount of time until gaining full access to whatever your password was protecting. Use a combination of uppercase and lowercase letters, symbols and numbers.

data.name: Blog_BSTSSCE_H1_SH2_Text2
data.value: And don’t forget - if in need of inspiration you can use our password generator. Based on statistical analysis of actual text, it produces strong passwords that are not nonsensical and actually possible to remember and type. You’ll get three suggestions of decreasing strength and complexity. Try it out by clicking this following link: https://www.axcrypt.net/support/password-generator

data.name: Blog_BSTSSCE_H1_SH4_Text1
data.value: End-to-end encryption gives you back control and protects your data from snoopers and prying eyes. Encryption is the best working way so far to secure your data of any form of unwanted access. By taking plain text and using mathematical calculations to turn data into code it is converted into cipher text, only those who have the special key can decrypt your files.

data.name: Blog_BSTSSCE_H1_SH4_Text2
data.value: Premium and business customers have access to our extra strong encryption method: AES-256. The Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) 256 is adopted by federal agencies like the National Security Agency (NSA) where national security is involved. AES-256 is the strongest, most secure and most efficient encryption algorithm available nowadays. AES uses symmetric key encryption: one secret key is used to cipher and decipher. Symmetric keys are better suited to internal encryption, faster and in need of less computational power it is therefore an effective mechanism. The plaintext, which is the information to be encrypted, is divided into sections of 256-bit block size after a few rounds of substitutions, permutations and linear transformations the data is transformed into code. The size of the encrypted data remains the same: 256 bits of plaintext yields 256 bits of ciphertext.

data.name: Blog_BSTSSCE_H1_SH4_Text3
data.value: To sum up, encryption is fundamental to contemporary internet security. It is an extremely complicated subject but we are proud at AxCrypt to make the process of it simple and friendly to use for everyone.

data.name: Blog_CEANK_H1_Heading2
data.value: Some Characteristics of the Cloud

data.name: Blog_CEANK_H1_Text1
data.value: The cloud is a network that refers to all the data servers that are placed all over the world including their software and database sometimes operated offshore. It permits users to access the same files or applications anywhere at any time via the Internet as the information is stored on the servers instead of local devices such as computers or phones. The files are moreover stored various times on distinct data centers so that the information remains available if any problem should occur. Over time, businesses switched to cloud computing removing in that way some costs and the endeavor of taking care and maintaining their own servers.This convenient, on-demand network does not crack, gets lost or stolen. The cloud is a promising technology that enables collaboration, flexibility, reliability and high productivity.

data.name: Blog_CEANK_H2_SH1_Text1
data.value: Providers rent out basic storage capacity on virtual servers according to their need instead of buying an expensive hardware. Exemples for that can be SaaS applications including Salesforce, MailChimp, and Slack. SaaS is like renting a house: the landlord maintains the house, but the tenant mostly gets to use it.

data.name: Blog_CEANK_H2_SH2_Text1
data.value: Businesses pay for development tools, infrastructure and operating systems they need to to build their own application to then upload it on their devices. Heroku and Microsoft Azure belong to the PaaS categorie. PaaS can be compared to renting all the tools and equipment necessary for building a house.

data.name: Blog_CEANK_H2_SH3_Text1
data.value: In this model, a company rents the servers and storage they need from a cloud provider. They then use that cloud infrastructure to build their applications. IaaS providers include DigitalOcean, Google Compute Engine, and OpenStack. IaaS is like a company leasing a plot of land.

data.name: Blog_CEANK_H2_SubHeading1
data.value: IaaS - Infrastructure as a Service

data.name: Blog_CEANK_H2_SubHeading2
data.value: PaaS - Platform as a Service

data.name: Blog_CEANK_H2_SubHeading3
data.value: SaaS - Software as a Service

data.name: Blog_CEANK_H2_Text1
data.value:
Virtualization is the technology that allows cloud computing. By creating a simulation of a physical computer called virtual machines, we implement the capacity of servers and data centers to stock information.

There are different categories that will characterize computing cloud storage

data.name: Blog_CEANK_H2_Text2
data.value: There are different categories that will characterize computing cloud storage, here are the different services:

data.name: Blog_CEANK_H4_Text1
data.value: Personal data is any information relating to an identifiable person. Examples for that could be name, address, occupation, income, political opinions, healthcare information and IP address of course.

data.name: Blog_CEANK_H4_Text2
data.value: Our Swedish company takes privacy law as a matter of hearth. Business or private customers have the right to ask about the level of privacy your personal data has when stored in the cloud. Moreover if you work and deal with data of European citizens, the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) comes into effect and therefore it is important to be well informed. The GDPR is clearly in favour of encryption as the European Commission conferred that data protection outside the EU is not effective enough, Switzerland is nevertheless a rare exception. The US politic through data protection is a political subject that divides the population. Because of the Patriot Act, authorities have the right to inspect intensively personal data without even a court order. Problem is then that most of the cloud providers companies such as Dropbox, Microsoft, or Google are affiliated on US ground.

We make it easy for you to automatically view and keep the files secured on these folders. To access this feature, have a look at a business subscription if you're part of a company or a premium subscription if you're a private indiviudal.

data.value: We offer Zero Knowledge encryption. Zero knowledge cloud encryption safeguards your privacy, in short your personal data is encrypted in the best possible way and there is no way for cloud providers nor us to identify your accreditation. Stronger than a forretress our encryption method will keep all your information safe and secure. Nevertheless, you have to remember your password. If it is forgotten your data will remain encrypted forever and therefore useless.

data.name: Blog_CEMDWYRNTK_Conclusion_Text1
data.value: Believing in cybersecurity myths can lead to significant risks, leaving your data and personal information vulnerable to attacks. By understanding and debunking these common myths, you can take the necessary steps to protect your sensitive information.

data.name: Blog_CEMDWYRNTK_Conclusion_Text2
data.value: Exploring reliable encryption solutions like AxCrypt can be a powerful step toward safeguarding your data. AxCrypt’s user-friendly yet robust encryption software ensures that even non-technical users can effectively secure their information without sacrificing convenience.

data.name: Blog_CEMDWYRNTK_Conclusion_Text3
data.value: Don’t let misinformation put your data at risk. By sharing this post, we hope to spread awareness and help others debunk these myths, fostering a more secure and informed digital community. Remember, knowledge is the biggest threat to cybercriminals—so stay informed, stay secure, and take proactive steps to protect your data today.

data.name: Blog_CEMDWYRNTK_H1_Text1
data.value: Myth 1: Only large companies are targeted in cyberattacks

data.name: Blog_CEMDWYRNTK_H1_Text10
data.value: Myth 4: Deleting files is enough to secure your data

data.name: Blog_CEMDWYRNTK_H1_Text11
data.value: Deleting a file from your computer doesn’t completely erase it. Residual data often remains, and skilled individuals can recover these “deleted” files. Simply hitting “delete” isn’t enough to ensure your sensitive information is gone forever.

data.name: Blog_CEMDWYRNTK_H1_Text12
data.value: AxCrypt possesses a permanent deletion with wipe file feature, ensuring no trace is left when you delete a file, keeping your sensitive data out of reach.

data.name: Blog_CEMDWYRNTK_H1_Text13
data.value: Myth 5: Encryption solutions aren’t worth it

data.name: Blog_CEMDWYRNTK_H1_Text14
data.value: Some organizations and individuals underestimate the value of encryption software, assuming they can manage without it. However, given the increasing prevalence of cyber threats, the cost of encryption software is minimal compared to the potential losses from data breaches, ransomware, or other cyber incidents.

data.name: Blog_CEMDWYRNTK_H1_Text15
data.value: AxCrypt has consistently aimed to offer an affordable security solution without sacrificing protection. With AxCrypt, you get all these powerful features at a budget-friendly price, making it a wise investment in your digital security.

data.name: Blog_CEMDWYRNTK_H1_Text16
data.value: Myth 6: Encryption is Only for Tech Experts

data.name: Blog_CEMDWYRNTK_H1_Text17
data.value: There’s a misconception that encryption is too complex for the average person. However, many modern tools and applications offer easy-to-use encryption features, often running in the background without requiring technical expertise.

data.name: Blog_CEMDWYRNTK_H1_Text18
data.value: AxCrypt is one of the most popular encryption software on the market, with over 20 million downloads worldwide. For AxCrypt, it was important to appeal to the average person to reach a wide, universal audience. That’s why the software has consistently been developed to be user-friendly while possessing the most robust encryption available. This is why AxCrypt is often described as a seamless encryption option.

data.name: Blog_CEMDWYRNTK_H1_Text19
data.value: Myth 7: All Encryption is the Same

data.name: Blog_CEMDWYRNTK_H1_Text2
data.value: A common misconception is that small and medium-sized businesses (SMBs) aren’t frequent targets of cyberattacks. Media coverage tends to focus on data breaches at large corporations, leading many to believe that smaller businesses are safe. However, the reality is quite different—many SMBs report being attacked, and some studies suggest that small businesses are three times more likely to be targeted than large ones.

data.name: Blog_CEMDWYRNTK_H1_Text20
data.value: People often believe that all forms of encryption provide the same level of security. In reality, different encryption methods offer varying levels of security.

data.name: Blog_CEMDWYRNTK_H1_Text21
data.value: AxCrypt provides several types of Encryptions:

data.name: Blog_CEMDWYRNTK_H1_Text22
data.value: AES-256 Encryption - AES-256 encryption is a form of the Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) that uses a 256-bit key to encrypt and decrypt data. This is the most robust encryption service on the market.

data.name: Blog_CEMDWYRNTK_H1_Text23
data.value: Symmetric Key Encryption - AxCrypt utilizes symmetric key encryption, meaning that the same password (key) is required to both encrypt and decrypt files.

data.name: Blog_CEMDWYRNTK_H1_Text24
data.value: Password management - AxCrypt’s Password Management service significantly reduces the risk of unauthorized access to your online accounts.

data.name: Blog_CEMDWYRNTK_H1_Text25
data.value: Integrated Key Management - AxCrypt also offers a key management feature, where users can securely share encrypted files with others by managing keys within the software.

data.name: Blog_CEMDWYRNTK_H1_Text26
data.value: Myth 8: Encryption Slows Down Systems Significantly

data.name: Blog_CEMDWYRNTK_H1_Text27
data.value: While encryption does add some processing overhead, modern encryption services like AxCrypt are designed to handle it efficiently. The impact of AxCrypt on performance is minimal and often unnoticeable.

data.name: Blog_CEMDWYRNTK_H1_Text28
data.value: Myth 9: Encryption is Only Necessary for Sensitive Information

data.name: Blog_CEMDWYRNTK_H1_Text29
data.value: This myth leads to the assumption that only things like financial data or personal identity information need to be encrypted.

data.name: Blog_CEMDWYRNTK_H1_Text3
data.value: AxCrypt has a comprehensive protection for businesses. AxCrypt’s business plan is tailored for companies of all sizes, ensuring that even SMBs can prevent data breaches.

data.name: Blog_CEMDWYRNTK_H1_Text30
data.value: The fact is that by keeping all data encrypted, sensitive information will be kept even safer. Seemingly non-sensitive information can be valuable to attackers, and data breaches of non-sensitive information can be used to commit an attack on sensitive data.

data.name: Blog_CEMDWYRNTK_H1_Text31
data.value: Myth 10: You Don’t Need to Encrypt Data Stored in the Cloud

data.name: Blog_CEMDWYRNTK_H1_Text32
data.value: Some believe that cloud service providers will handle all aspects of security, including encryption. While some providers do offer encryption most of them don’t have complete protection.

data.name: Blog_CEMDWYRNTK_H1_Text33
data.value: AxCrypt has been vocal in debunking this myth. This misconception may be dangerous since cloud software services often give the impression of being a completely secure option. That’s why AxCrypt has been outspoken about this issue and has ensured synchronization with all major cloud software services (OneDrive, Google Drive, Dropbox, etc.).

data.name: Blog_CEMDWYRNTK_H1_Text4
data.value: Myth 2: A good password is enough

data.name: Blog_CEMDWYRNTK_H1_Text5
data.value: While strong passwords are important, relying solely on a password, even a complex one, leaves your data vulnerable. Hackers continuously develop new methods to crack passwords, making it crucial to implement a multi-layered defence strategy. Two-factor authentication, encryption, and regular updates are essential to safeguarding your information.

data.name: Blog_CEMDWYRNTK_H1_Text6
data.value: Beyond just managing passwords, AxCrypt encrypts all your files, securing your information in the cloud and on your devices—even if your passwords are compromised.

data.name: Blog_CEMDWYRNTK_H1_Text7
data.value: Myth 3: You’ll know immediately if your computer is compromised

data.name: Blog_CEMDWYRNTK_H1_Text8
data.value: Many people believe that they will recognize the signs of a cyberattack as soon as it occurs. However, modern malware is often designed to be stealthy, operating undetected for extended periods. This delay increases the potential damage as sensitive data can be compromised without your knowledge.

data.name: Blog_CEMDWYRNTK_H1_Text9
data.value: This is what we call peace of mind with file encryption. Cyberattacks may be hard to stop, but with AxCrypt, your data remains safe regardless of what happens to your devices.

data.name: Blog_CEMDWYRNTK_Heading1
data.value: Myths

data.name: Blog_CEMDWYRNTK_Summary
data.value: With an increasing reliance on technology and the cloud to store our information, data encryption has become a critical concern nowadays. Despite our knowledge on the topic and the importance it has for our safety, many people and businesses still fall prey to common encryption myths. These misconceptions, which contrast sharply with reality, can give a false sense of security, leading to inadequate protection and increasing vulnerability.

data.name: Blog_CEMDWYRNTK_Text1
data.value: With an increasing reliance on technology and the cloud to store our information, data encryption has become a critical concern nowadays. Despite our knowledge on the topic and the importance it has for our safety, many people and businesses still fall prey to common encryption myths. These misconceptions, which contrast sharply with reality, can give a false sense of security, leading to inadequate protection and increasing vulnerability.

data.name: Blog_CEMDWYRNTK_Text2
data.value: Myths can, in some cases, be a good thing for people, providing a sense of belief in something important. However, many myths about encryption are not beneficial; in fact, they can be rather dangerous and devastating. Today, we put our most important data and personal information into our tiny devices, assuming it will stay safe there. We use these same devices to keep in contact with people in every aspect of our lives, often connecting them to WiFi networks without knowing whether they are safe or not.

data.name: Blog_CEMDWYRNTK_Text3
data.value: Given our dependence on these devices, it’s even more important for people to navigate this digital age with caution. Unfortunately, many of the myths circulating about encryption result in less precaution being taken. Some may avoid using encryption, thinking it’s too complex, or believe that storing everything in the cloud will keep it safe. Not true!

data.name: Blog_CEMDWYRNTK_Text4
data.value: In this post, we aim to debunk some of the most common myths regarding encryption to increase readers’ security and provide practical advice. To help take our online security seriously, we will offer concrete solutions that can tackle cybersecurity problems. Even in difficult times, with increasing threats, encryption tools like AxCrypt can assist in keeping us safe online.

data.name: Blog_CEMDWYRNTK_Title
data.value: Common Encryption Myths Debunked: What You Really Need to Know

data.name: Blog_CHHSSO_Conclusion_Text1
data.value: Developing a cyber hygiene practice will prevent hackers from causing security breaches or obtaining personal information. It will also assist you in staying up to date with software and operating systems.

data.name: Blog_CHHSSO_Conclusion_Text2
data.value: AxCrypt offers strong encryption with 256-bit encryption to secure your data in the three stages of data; data at rest, at transit, and in use. It also provides a collaboration tool that allows users to share secured files and data with other AxCrypt users.

data.name: Blog_CHHSSO_H1_Text1
data.value: The term “cyber hygiene” refers to the measures taken by users to improve their online security and system health. Adopting a security-focused mindset and practices that assist individuals and businesses in minimizing cyber attacks is referred to as cyber hygiene.

data.name: Blog_CHHSSO_H1_Text2
data.value: As a concept, cyber hygiene has grown in importance since the pandemic, as individuals working remotely throughout the world have increased cybercrime.

data.name: Blog_CHHSSO_H2_Text1
data.value: Some of the issues that cyber hygiene is intended to solve are as follows:

data.name: Blog_CHHSSO_H2_Text2
data.value: • Data breaches include risks from hackers, phishing, malware, and viruses.

data.name: Blog_CHHSSO_H2_Text3
data.value: • Data loss — unbacked-up hard drives and online cloud storage might be exposed to hacking, damage, or other issues that result in data loss.

data.name: Blog_CHHSSO_H2_Text4
data.value: • Out-of-date software can make your device more vulnerable to cyber threats.

data.name: Blog_CHHSSO_H2_Text5
data.value: • Older antivirus – security software that hasn't been maintained up to date will be less effective at defending you from the most recent cyber dangers.

data.name: Blog_CHHSSO_H3_SH1_Text1
data.value: Antivirus scanning regularly can help in the prevention of problems. Files will be protected from persistent internet threats if they are correctly maintained. This will also prevent files from fragmenting and resulting in data loss.

data.name: Blog_CHHSSO_H3_SH2_Text1
data.value: Encryption transforms plain text into ciphertext or converts readable text into unreadable text to protect data so that only certain people can access it. Encryption scrambles or encrypts data and then utilizes a key to unscramble or decrypt the information for the receiving party. It proves to be a successful method of safeguarding sensitive data. Data on computers and storage devices and data in transit through networks are all protected with encryption.

data.name: Blog_CHHSSO_H3_SH3_Text1
data.value: It is essential to have secure passwords for all of your devices. Your passwords should be unique and complicated, with at least 12 characters, including numbers, capital, lowercase letters, and symbols. Changing your passwords regularly — will help keep hackers at bay. AxCrypt provides a password management generator that ensures their passwords are strong and secure.

data.name: Blog_CHHSSO_H3_SH4_Text1
data.value: Backups should be kept in a distinct location from the originals and tested regularly. To securely save personal files, create a backup on a separate device (e.g., the cloud or an encrypted USB). You can encrypt your drive data with AxCrypt, which encrypts data in transit, rest, and storage. In addition, you retain control over your encryption keys, allowing you to keep command even after data has left your building.

data.value: High-quality antivirus software

data.value: A strong password manager

data.value: Regular backup

data.name: Blog_CHHSSO_H3_Text1
data.value: In 2023, cybercriminals are expected to steal 33 billion records. As a result, good cyber hygiene is a common practice that can assist you in keeping your data safe and secure online.

data.value: Due to the quick development of the mobile phone business and the advent of cloud services and apps, mobile phones are increasingly more vulnerable. In contrast to the growth in smartphone adoption, mobile security has not yet reached millions of consumers.

data.name: Blog_CRI_Conclusion_Text1
data.value: As we are all aware, cyber-attacks have increased immensely and evolve every day. Cyber resilience helps the organization maintain service and business continuity by reducing any cyber disasters. Even now, many organizations are still not adequate in dealing with cyber incidents. Enjoy the benefits of choking cyber-attacks.

data.name: Blog_CRI_FeaturePage
data.value: Have a Look at the feature page to find out more about how AxCrypt can secure your files and data.

data.name: Blog_CRI_H1_SH1_Text1
data.value: Identify:This phase involves getting to understand the various cybersecurity flaws that exist inside the networks, systems, users, and data, as well as your ICT skills that might be in danger.

data.name: Blog_CRI_H1_SH1_Text2
data.value: Protect: It is very important to provide the best tiers of security regarding the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of data privacy, benefiting from providing the best protection against cyberattacks, unauthorized access, and systemic failure.

data.name: Blog_CRI_H1_SH1_Text3
data.value: Detect:It is very important to identify beforehand if someone is getting ready to act maliciously against you. And this can be availed by continual monitoring of network and data systems, which enables recognizing anomalies, unexpected issues, and potential cybersecurity incidents.

data.name: Blog_CRI_H1_SH1_Text4
data.value: Respond:In this phase, implementation of proper disaster planning and appropriate actions to resolve a real-time cyber security incident must be ensured, so that it doesn’t affect business continuity even though you are the victim of a cyber-attack.

data.name: Blog_CRI_H1_SH1_Text5
data.value: Recover:This is the final phase where the main objective is to identify appropriate actions in restoring the service or operations affected by a cyber security breach and mitigate its consequences. If the attack had been prevented, it would have been much easier to restore the integrity of the system at the earliest. This phase also identifies the future activities involved in supporting the resilience of an organization's cybersecurity infrastructure.

data.name: Blog_CRI_H1_SubHeading1
data.value: Five key pillars of cyber resilience:

data.name: Blog_CRI_H1_Text1
data.value: It is crucial for an organization to create a more robust cyber strategy to resist the flood of threats and attacks from all over the world. Cyber resilience is the capacity to foresee, tolerate, and recover from any cyberthreats and data breaches. They also control system attacks through online resources. The main aim of cyber resilience is to secure organizational functionality and endure all the crises, dangers, adversities, emergencies and difficulties that are both known and unforeseen. Cyber resilience is a new security paradigm that stimulates a proactive security strategy including planning, responding, and recovering from cyber-attacks without affecting regular business operations, business continuity and business acceleration.

data.name: Blog_CRI_H2_SH1_Text1
data.value: Augmented Systems Security:Cyber ​​resilience is not only used for responding to and surviving an attack, but also helps in developing strategies for improvising IT governance, critical asset security and data privacy. Resilience also helps in avoiding the various outcomes faced due to natural disasters or reducing human error.

data.name: Blog_CRI_H2_SH1_Text2
data.value: Minimal Financial Loss:One of the main advantages of cyber resilience is decreased downtime and financial losses. Cyber resilience provides a plan which helps minimize business disruption and hence reduce financial losses in a timely and accurate manner.

data.name: Blog_CRI_H2_SH1_Text3
data.value: Swift Recovery Time:Apart from these, cyber resilience also accelerates the recovery process, supporting you to get your business back up and running as quickly as possible.

data.name: Blog_CRI_H2_SH1_Text4
data.value: Reputation Protection:Each employee is liable for protecting sensitive data and hard assets of the organization, ensuring an appropriate incident response, in turn reducing the risk factors. Poor cyber resilience can irreversibly damage an organization's reputation.

data.name: Blog_CRI_H2_SH1_Text5
data.value: Better IT Team:Cyber resilience improves IT department operations, enabling them to respond to threats and helping them to run daily operations smoothly.

data.name: Blog_CRI_H2_SH1_Text6
data.value: Improved Customer Confidence:Cyber incidents damage a company’s reputation. Cyber resilience can reassure customer confidence by providing the assurance of keeping their data secured. This increases customer confidence and in turn increases the sales of the organization.

data.name: Blog_CRI_H2_SubHeading1
data.value: Benefits of having Cyber Resilience:

data.name: Blog_CRI_H2_Text1
data.value: Nowadays the security environment is changing persistently. Organizations and individuals are targeted by hackers and disasters and hence it is a major aspect to keep the data and credentials cyber-safe. Cyber security is the best way to achieve business continuity. Implementing resilience of the information architecture of an organization reduces the likelihood of an attack, in turn minimizing and reducing the damage. Cyber resilience not only reduces existing threats but also lowers long-term threats from various hi-tech technologies like artificial intelligence, quantum computing, memcomputing or IoT.

data.name: Blog_CRI_Heading1
data.value: What is Cyber Resilience?

data.name: Blog_CRI_Heading2
data.value: Why do you require Cyber Resilience?

data.name: Blog_CRI_Summary
data.value: In today's modern world, cyberattacks like malware, phishing, password and SQL injection attacks have increased enormously.

data.name: Blog_CRI_Text1
data.value: In today's modern world, cyberattacks like malware, phishing, password and SQL injection attacks have increased enormously. The main target of hackers is stealing or deleting confidential data from a computer network, database, or personal devices. According to Cybersecurity Ventures, it is said, by 2025 cybercrime will cost the global economy $10.5 trillion every year. And it is very vital to develop a strong reaction to this issue given the scope of this criminal conduct. Cyber-attacks are so crucial that they can disable, destroy or disrupt computer systems. They can even control the entire system and can change, modify, block, erase, or steal the data stored within. Normally created and initiated by a person or group using one or more attack tactics via the internet.

If the firm wants to avoid ransomware and malware, all personnel must be adequately educated in security best practices and good habits.

data.value: Recognizing when a cyberattack has occurred might be more difficult for an employee than avoiding one in the first place, but there are a few warning signals. Employees should be constantly educated about what to look for if they fear they have been hacked.

data.name: Blog_CSFE_H1_Text2
data.value: Being aware of cybersecurity in everyday situations is referred to as cybersecurity awareness. Cybersecurity awareness includes being conscious of the risks of browsing the web, checking email, and engaging online. Employees must regard cybersecurity as a vital aspect of their roles as business executives.
