data.name: MasterKeyApprovalInfo
data.value: If approved, Master key will be applied to encrypted files and possible to recover by business administrators. If you want to stop having Master key applied, you can leave the business at any time (this is done in your My AxCrypt ID page).

data.name: MasterKeyApprovedTitle
data.value: Master key approved

data.name: MasterKeyBlock1Heading
data.value: Master key introduction

data.name: MasterKeyBlock1Text1
data.value: Master key is a feature which enables business administrators to recover files of the business members.

data.name: MasterKeyBlock1Text2
data.value: Imagine an important financial document being encrypted after creating the yearly revenue report. During the following year a new financial team is put in place, and when it's time for the yearly report they realize the financial document the previous team used, is now encrypted with credentials no one has access to any longer.

data.name: MasterKeyBlock1Text3
data.value: Enter Master key! With Master key enabled, the administrators of the business can always recover any file encrypted by the business members. In the above case the new financial team just has to ask their administrator and the financial document can easily be recovered, even if the original user left the company.

data.name: MasterKeyBlock1Text4
data.value: As long as the business has one or a couple administrators who make sure to keep track of their credentials, no files will ever be lost due to employees leaving or forgetting their passwords.

data.name: MasterKeyBlock2Heading
data.value: Master key and security

data.name: MasterKeyBlock2Text1
data.value: When enabling master key, business administrators can recover any document encrypted by their members. This, as mentioned, eliminates the risk of losing access to critical files. But is it secure?

data.name: MasterKeyBlock2Text2
data.value: In terms of security, you can view Master key as an automatic sharing of files with the administrators of the business. Administrators will automatically be able to recover files which has their Master key applied. This is no less secure than simply using AxCrypt's tried and tested Key Sharing feature.

data.name: MasterKeyBlock2Text3
data.value: Of course, business administrators need to be extra careful to choose good passwords and keeping their account safe at all times.

data.name: MasterKeyBlock3Heading
data.value: Enabling master key

data.name: MasterKeyBlock3Text1
data.value: Master key can be enabled from the manage subscription page.

data.name: MasterKeyBlock3Text2
data.value: After enabling Master key, all existing member of the business have to approve the change. This is an important security consideration, an existing user should never feel like this feature was hidden from them. Who has accepted the Master key feature can be seen in the user table.

data.name: MasterKeyBlock3Text3
data.value: If a user has not accepted Master key, it will not be applied to files they encrypt, so make sure everyone in your business accepts the feature.

data.name: MasterKeyBlock3Text4
data.value: Note! Files encrypted before enabling Master key will of course not be possible to recover. Old files have to be re-encrypted after the user having accepted master key.

data.name: MasterKeyBlock3Text5
data.value: For new businesses, or new members of existing businesses, Master key will be automatically approved when members joins the business.

data.name: MasterKeyBlock4Heading
data.value: Using Master Key

data.name: MasterKeyBlock4Text1
data.value: Once Master key has been enabled, it will be automatically applied to all files encrypted by members of the business. You can see if Master key has been applied by the Master key icon shown in the application.

data.name: MasterKeyBlock4Text2
data.value: If a file has this icon, then any business administrator can recover the file.

data.name: MasterKeyBlock4Text3
data.value: That's it! As you can see, Master key is very easy to use and nothing your business member ever have to consider or spend time on.

data.name: MasterKeyBlock4Text4
data.value: Please note that even though business administrators can recover files using Master key, this should not be used in normal usage. If a file is intended to be opened by a business administrator, then the file should Key shared with that user, just as with any other user.

data.name: MasterKeyBlock4Text5
data.value: Files encrypted before enabling Master key will of course not be possible to recover. Old files must be re-encrypted after the user having accepted master key.

data.name: MasterKeyBlock4Text6
data.value: After Master Key enabled, sign out If already signed in and sign in back to the AxCrypt Application. An information message popup will appear to inform about the master key enabled.

data.name: MasterKeyBlock4Text7
data.value: You can see if Master key has been applied by the Master key icon shown in the application. If a file has this icon, then any group administrator can recover the file.

data.name: MasterKeyBlock4Text8
data.value: That's it! As you can see, Master key is very easy to use and nothing your business member ever must consider or spend time on.

data.name: MasterKeyBlock5Heading
data.value: Need more help?

data.name: MasterKeyBlock5Text1
data.value: Our priority business support is always standing by to help with any questions or concerns. Use the form on your account page, or send us a mail at business@axcrypt.net and we'll help you out!

data.name: MasterKeyBlock5Text2
data.value: Please note that while Group Administrators or Master Key Owners can recover files using the Master Key, this functionality should not be relied upon for regular usage. If a file is intended to be opened by a group administrator, it should be key shared with that user, just like with any non-admin user.

data.name: MasterKeyBlocksl1Heading
data.value: Enable / Disable Master Key

data.name: MasterKeyBlocksl1Note
data.value: Note: Master Key Owner must be selected before enabling the Master Key. Only Master Key Owner and Group Administrator can enable the master key.

data.name: MasterKeyBlocksl1subText3
data.value: Toggle the action button to enable Master Key for the corresponding group.

data.name: MasterKeyBlocksl1subText4
data.value: Toggle the action button to disable Master Key for the master key enabled group.

data.name: MasterKeyBlocksl1Text1
data.value: Login to your AxCrypt Business account

data.name: MasterKeyBlocksl1Text2
data.value: Go to Master Key side-menu

data.name: MasterKeyBlocksl1Text3
data.value: Enable Master Key

data.name: MasterKeyBlocksl1Text4
data.value: Disable Master Key

data.name: MasterKeyBlocksl1Text5
data.value: Provide your consent by selecting the checkbox “I Understand” and then click the “Understand” button below.

data.name: MasterKeyBlocksl2Heading
data.value: Approve Master Key

data.name: MasterKeyBlocksl2Note
data.value: Once master key enabled, all the existing group members needs to approve. This is an important security consideration, and an existing user should never feel like this feature was hidden from them.

data.name: MasterKeyBlocksl2Note2
data.value: Note: A Group Administrator who enabled the Master Key will be auto approved.

data.name: MasterKeyBlocksl2Note3
data.value: Note: A Group Administrator who enabled the Master Key will be auto approved.

data.name: MasterKeyBlocksl2Text1
data.value: Login to your AxCrypt Business account

data.name: MasterKeyBlocksl2Text2
data.value: Go to AxCrypt ID side-menu

data.name: MasterKeyBlocksl2Text3
data.value: Navigate to groups section

data.name: MasterKeyBlocksl2Text4
data.value: Click Approve Master Key for the corresponding group action menu.

data.name: MasterKeyBlocksl2Text5
data.value: Provide consent to Approve Master Key .

data.name: MasterKeyBusinessHelpInfo1
data.value: Use the checkbox below to make it possible for AxCrypt to help recover files in case business administrators forgets their password. This should only be used upon explicit request for a verified business administrator!

data.name: MasterKeyBusinessHelpInfo2
data.value: This feature makes it possible for AxCrypt to recover files encrypted by members of this business. It should only be applied on explicit request by the business!

data.name: MasterKeyBusinessHelpPrompt
data.value: AxCrypt Recovery Backup

data.name: MasterKeyDescription
data.value: Enable business administrators to recover lost files

data.name: MasterKeyDisableHelpText
data.value: If Master key is disabled, business administrators will not be able to open files encrypted by their business members.

data.name: MasterKeyGuideBlock1Heading
data.value: What is Master Key?

data.name: MasterKeyGuideBlock1Text1
data.value: Master key is a feature which enables Master Key Owner and Group Administrators to recover files of the group members.

data.name: MasterKeyGuideBlock1Text3
data.value: Enter Master key! With Master key enabled, the administrators of the group can always recover any file encrypted by the group members. In the above case the new financial team just has to ask their group administrator, and the financial document can easily be recovered, even if the original user left the company.

data.name: MasterKeyGuideBlock1Text4
data.value: As long as the Master Key Owner or group administrators who make sure to keep track of their credentials, no files will ever be lost due to employees leaving or forgetting their passwords.

data.name: MasterKeyGuideBlock2Heading
data.value: Who is Master Key Owner?

data.name: MasterKeyGuideBlock2Text1
data.value: A Master Key Owner holds special rights to recover any file encrypted by all Group’s members when Master Key is enabled, even not being a member of the group.

data.name: MasterKeyGuideBlock2Text2
data.value: Only one Business Administrator can be a Master Key Owner. A new Master Key Owner can be assigned only by the current Master Key Owner, by selecting from the Business Administrators list.

data.name: MasterKeyGuideBlock2Text3
data.value: Also, Master Key Owner can enable/disable the group’s master key. A Master Key Owner can recover any files encrypted by the group members when group administrator lost master key access.

data.name: MasterKeyGuideBlock3Heading
data.value: What is the purpose of Master Key?

data.name: MasterKeyGuideBlock3Text1
data.value: When Master Key enabled for a Group, a Master Key Owner or Group Administrators can recover any file encrypted by that Group members. This, as mentioned, eliminates the risk of losing access to critical files. But is it secure?

data.name: MasterKeyGuideBlock3Text2
data.value: In terms of security, you can view Master key as an automatic sharing of files with Administrators of the group. Group Administrators will automatically be able to recover files which has their Master key applied. This is no less secure than simply using AxCrypt's tried and tested Key Sharing feature.

data.name: MasterKeyGuideBlock3Text3
data.value: Of course, Group Administrators need to be extra careful to choose strong passwords and always keep their account safe.

data.name: MasterKeyGuideBlock4Heading
data.value: How does Master Key work?

data.name: MasterKeyGuideBlock4Text1
data.value: If a user has not accepted Master key, it will not be applied to files they encrypt, so make sure everyone in your group accepts the feature.

data.name: MasterKeyGuideBlock4Text2
data.value: Group Administrator can view, who has accepted the Master key feature in the user's page.

data.name: MasterKeyGuideBlock4Text3
data.value: For new members of existing businesses, Master key will be automatically approved when members join the business.

data.name: MasterKeyGuideBlock4Text4
data.value: Once Master key has been enabled, it will be automatically applied to all files encrypted by members of the group.

data.name: MasterKeyGuideBlock5Text1
data.value: Business created before the group feature, Default group was created with all the business members and master key data securely moved from business to default group.

data.name: MasterKeyHelpText1
data.value: Master key enables business administrators to open files encrypted by the members of the business. Note, the member first has to approve master key before it being applied to their files. You can see who has approved master key in the user table. For more information, click here.

data.name: MasterKeyHelpText2
data.value: Files which were encrypted before enabling master key will not be possible to open without the original encryption credentials.

data.name: MasterKeyInfoPopupText
data.value: Master key is enabled. This means your business administrators can recover your secured files.
data.comment: Inform all the desktop users about the master key feature.

data.name: MasterKeyOldEncryptedFilesHelpText
data.value: Files encrypted before this will not be possible to recover with master key. If you know there are files you need to have master key applied to please inform the user to stop protecting the files and then start protecting them again. This will re-encrypt the files, including the master key.

data.name: MasterKeyOwnerDescriptionText
data.value: Select one of the business administrators as the master key owner. The master key owner has access to all the files secured by the group(s).

data.name: MasterKeyOwnerHeadingText
data.value: Master Key Owner

data.name: MasterKeyOwnerInfoText1
data.value: A Master Key Owner holds special rights to recover any file encrypted by all Group’s members when Master Key is enabled, even not being a member of the group.

data.name: MasterKeyOwnerInfoText2
data.value: Also, Master Key Owner can enable/disable the group’s master key and recover files when group administrator lost master key access.

data.name: MasterKeyRemovedWarningText
data.value: This file had a master key applied to it. Since you're not part of the same business, master key will be cleared from this file.

data.name: MasterKeyResellerInfo
data.value: Reseller(s) are not allowed to manage master key(s) due to security reasons.

data.name: Nis2BenefitsSubParagraph1
data.value: Protects data at rest and in transit with AES-256 encryption.

data.value: Ensures only authorized users have access to encryption keys.

data.value: Helps quickly secure data during cybersecurity incidents.

data.name: Nis2BenefitsSubParagraph5
data.value: Provides encrypted backups for quick recovery and business continuity.

data.value: Promotes cybersecurity best practices through an intuitive interface and educational content.

data.name: Nis2ClauseRowText1
data.value: Stronger Encryption

data.name: Nis2ClauseRowText10
data.value: Access Controls

data.name: Nis2ClauseRowText11
data.value: Ensure only authorized personnel have access to critical systems and data.

data.name: Nis2ClauseRowText12
data.value: Zero-Knowledge: AxCrypt's zero-knowledge architecture means encryption keys never leave the user’s device, eliminating unauthorized access risks even during critical incidents. AxCrpt’s Secure File Sharing feature allows for decryption of files with temporary keys by the recipients, ensuring high security of the data.

data.name: Nis2ClauseRowText2
data.value: Implement cryptographic measures to protect sensitive data.

data.name: Nis2ClauseRowText3
data.value:
Award-Winning Encryption: AxCrypt’s Military-grade AES-256 encryption protects data at rest and in transit.

Secure File Sharing: Temporary decryption keys minimize risk during collaboration.

data.name: Nis2ClauseRowText4
data.value: Cybersecurity Training & Hygiene

data.name: Nis2ClauseRowText5
data.value: Train employees on cybersecurity best practices.

data.name: Nis2ClauseRowText6
data.value:
User-Friendly Interface: AxCrypt’s user-friendly UI Promotes good security habits through easy encryption and access controls.

Educational Resources: AxCrypt’s blogs and user guides offer valuable data security insights.

data.name: Nis2ClauseRowText7
data.value: Better Business Continuity

data.name: Nis2ClauseRowText8
data.value: Ensure operations continue after a cyber incident.

data.name: Nis2ClauseRowText9
data.value: Encrypted Backups: Encrypted data backups on popular cloud storage provides for a quick recovery measure through the cloud services – ensuring streamlined business continuity during critical situations.

data.name: Nis2ComplyHeading1
data.value: How AxCrypt Supports NIS2 Compliance

data.name: Nis2ComplyParagraph
data.value: Here’s how precisely how AxCrypt can help you in your NIS2 compliance measures:

data.name: Nis2DescriptionParagraph1
data.value: AxCrypt simplifies your compliance journey with the NIS2 Directive. Our advanced encryption and access control solutions ensure your organization meets the stringent cybersecurity requirements mandated by the European Union.

data.name: Nis2DescriptionSubParagraph1
data.value: The NIS2 Directive aims to improve the cybersecurity of networks and information systems across the EU. Organizations must implement robust security measures to protect against cyber threats and ensure the continuity of essential services.

data.name: Nis2DescrptnHeading1
data.value: Simplified NIS2 Compliance with AxCrypt

data.name: Nis2DescrptnSubHeading1
data.value: NIS2 Overview

data.name: NIS2GuidelinesContent1
data.value: An easy to understand summary of NIS2 Guidelines

data.name: NIS2GuidelinesContent2
data.value: Birds-eye view of the compliance requirements

data.name: NIS2GuidelinesContent3
data.value: Checklist of assessments for your organisation

data.name: NIS2GuidelinesContent4
data.value: 10 steps of minimum measures to comply

data.name: NIS2GuidelinesContent5
data.value: Free 30-day trial of AxCrypt Business

data.name: NIS2GuidelinesParagraph1
data.value: Download our 12 page step-by-step action guide on how to get started complying with NIS2 guidelines for your organisations.

data.name: NIS2GuidelinesParagraph2
data.value: Use this guide to identify where your company stands in the guidelines and what is the level of compliance required to streamline the overall process.

data.name: Nis2InfoHeading1
data.value: Start Your NIS2 Compliance Journey today with AxCrypt

data.name: Nis2InfoParagraph1
data.value: AxCrypt is committed to helping your organization meet and exceed the cybersecurity standards set by the NIS2 Directive. With our robust encryption and access control solutions, you can protect your data, ensure operational continuity, and maintain regulatory compliance.

data.name: PartnerFaq1
data.value: What is AxCrypt’s Partner Program?

data.name: PartnerFaq1Ans
data.value: AxCrypt’s Partner Program lets you earn money by promoting AxCrypt’s data encryption software. You earn a percentage of each sale amount.

data.name: PartnerFaq2
data.value: Who can join AxCrypt’s Partner Program?

data.name: PartnerFaq2Ans
data.value: We'd love to have anyone passionate about data and cybersecurity join our partner program. However, you'll earn more if you're an influencer with a substantial following, a blogger, a direct marketer with a substantial client base, run a business, or work in the press.

data.name: PartnerFaq3
data.value: Is there any cost of joining the program?

data.name: PartnerFaq3Ans
data.value: Absolutely not. Our partner program is free to join.

data.name: PartnerFaq4
data.value: How much can I earn?

data.name: PartnerFaq4Ans
data.value: The sky's the limit. You'll receive a percentage of the sale amount — so the more sales, the more money.

data.name: PartnerFaq5
data.value: What’s the difference between becoming an Affiliate and a Reseller?

data.name: PartnerFaq5Ans
data.value: They differ in how you sell the products and earn a commission. As an Affiliate, you receive a fixed amount of commission when you make a sale, while as a Reseller, you set your own final price for the customer and retain the rest of the amount as your commission.

data.name: PartnerFaq6
data.value: How can I promote AxCrypt’s product?

data.name: PartnerFaq6Ans
data.value: You can promote AxCrypt's product through various channels such as your website, blog, social media platforms, email newsletters, webinars, and online forums. Additionally, you can create compelling content like reviews, tutorials, and case studies to showcase the benefits of AxCrypt's data encryption software.

data.name: PartnerGreatAffiliateText1
data.value: Are an influencer or creator with a medium to large following.

data.name: PartnerGreatAffiliateText2

data.name: PasswordGeneratorText1
data.value: Creating good passwords is hard. There are many tips and tricks on the Internet on how to do this manually, and there are also automatic password generators available. Some are good, some are less so.

data.name: PasswordGeneratorText2
data.value: The AxCrypt Password Generator is different. Based on statistical analysis of actual text, it produces strong passwords that are not nonsensical and actually possible to remember and type. Try it out by clicking the button below. You’ll get three suggestions of decreasing strength and complexity.

data.name: PasswordGeneratorText3

data.name: PasswordRulesInfo
data.value:
AxCrypt has a sophisticated password strength evaluator based on measuring the actual strength of the password. It must also be at least 8 effective characters long.
We evaluate the password by estimating the strength, which is based on how long and complex the password is.
The evaluation entirely disregards parts of the password that is recognized as being among the 1,000 most common passwords, as well as white space. For example the password 'secretX password Y 123456' is evaluated as just 'XY', since spaces, 'secret', 'password' and '123456' are ignored!
We classify the password in 4 categories of increasing strength, were we do not accept any password in the lowest category. The above example is not accepted for that reason.
data.comment: A text describing the rules for passwords for AxCrypt. Pure text. For HTML views, newlines must be replaced, and possibly wrap it with a CSS style.

data.name: PasswordRulesShortInfo
data.value:
AxCrypt uses an advanced dynamic password strength calculator.
White space, and parts that are equal to common passwords are ignored and do not add any strength.
data.comment: A shorter description of how password strength is evaluated.

data.name: PremiumFaq1
data.value: How does AxCrypt Premium protect my files?

data.name: PremiumFaq1Ans
data.value: AxCrypt Premium uses AES-256 encryption, a standard trusted by governments and security experts worldwide, ensuring your files are encrypted and protected from unauthorized access.

data.name: PremiumFaq2
data.value: Is AxCrypt Premium easy to use?

data.name: PremiumFaq2Ans
data.value: Yes! AxCrypt Premium is designed with simplicity in mind, allowing you to encrypt and protect your files with just a few clicks, without requiring any technical expertise.

data.name: PremiumFaq3
data.value: Is AxCrypt Premium suitable for my business?

data.name: PremiumFaq3Ans
data.value: No. AxCrypt Premium is designed specifically for individual users seeking robust encryption for personal use. For business needs, including team management and advanced security features, AxCrypt Business is the appropriate solution.

data.name: PremiumFaq4
data.value: Can I try AxCrypt Premium before committing?

data.name: PremiumFaq4Ans
data.value: Yes, we offer a 30-day free trial for AxCrypt Premium. This allows you to explore all premium features and assess if it meets your needs. Sign up for the trial on our Free Trial Page.

data.name: PremiumFaq5
data.value: What if I forget my password?

data.name: PremiumFaq5Ans
data.value: If you forget your AxCrypt password, you can reset it, but you won’t be able to access data encrypted with the old one. So, be sure to keep your password safe and memorable. For added security and convenience, consider using our Password Generator to create strong passwords and our Password Manager to securely store and manage them. The Password Generator ensures your passwords are complex and unique, while the Password Manager helps you organize and retrieve them effortlessly.

data.name: PremiumFeatureToolTipText
data.value: This feature requires a paid subscription plan!

data.name: PremiumFirstBodyHeading
data.value: AxCrypt Premium

data.name: PremiumFirstBodyText
data.value:
Interested in getting a subscription, but not sure if it fits your needs? You can enjoy 30 days of AxCrypt Premium for free.

With AxCrypt Premium, you have access to extended functionality and exciting features! Encrypt your files with AES-256 – the strongest of the AES algorithm. It is used globally to protect sensitive and classified information of all levels. Securing folders has never been easier, only taking a single click to automatically secure new files.

If you also need to share secured files with others, you will have key sharing to take care of that for you, even with access to cloud storage awareness in Dropbox, Google Drive and OneDrive etc. With the AxCrypt mobile app, you can encrypt and decrypt files on your phone, from anywhere and at any time.

Want to save password in a safe and easy way? Use our password management and generator to keep all your passwords safe in the cloud.

Try it out to discover all the features and benefits it offers!

data.name: PremiumPlusText

data.name: PremiumProductContent
data.value: For private users, secure sensitive documents, images, videos, passwords and more with AES-256. Securely share with anyone, sync to clouds, and access files from any device.

data.name: premiumproductkeyhead1
data.value: Stronger encryption with AES-256

data.name: premiumproductkeyhead2
data.value: Share your secure files with key sharing

data.name: premiumproductkeyhead3
data.value: Secure files online with cloud storage awareness

data.name: premiumproductkeyhead4
data.value: On-the-Go Mobile Encryption for Your Files

data.name: premiumproductkeyhead5
data.value: Strengthen Data Security with File Name Encryption

data.name: premiumproductkeyhead6
data.value: Securely delete files with file wipe

data.name: premiumproductkeyhead7
data.value: Generate, save, and share passwords, cards, & notes with Password Manager

data.name: premiumproductkeyhead8
data.value: Get Priority Support and Assistance for your queries

data.name: premiumproductkeyparagraph1
data.value: Advanced AES-256 encryption offers premium protection for your personal files in the three stages of data; data at rest, at transit, and in use. It has a key length of 256 bits and supports the greatest bit size and is practically unbreakable by brute force based on existing computing capability.

data.name: premiumproductkeyparagraph2
data.value: AxCrypt Premium's zero - knowledge encryption allows you to securely share encrypted files, ensuring that only your chosen recipients can access them. This makes collaboration both simple and safe, keeping your information private and protected at all times. Files remain secure, as unauthorized users cannot decrypt them without the necessary credentials.

data.name: premiumproductkeyparagraph3
data.value: Effortlessly sync your files with cloud folders on your desktop, including Google Drive, OneDrive, iCloud, and Dropbox. AxCrypt automatically encrypts your files before they are synced to the cloud, ensuring that your data remains secure whether it's stored locally or accessed from the cloud.

data.name: premiumproductkeyparagraph4
data.value: Encrypt and decrypt your files directly on your mobile devices, including Android and iOS, to keep your data secure while you're on the go. Mobile encryption protects your personal photos, videos, and sensitive documents from unauthorized access, shields your data in case of theft or breaches, and ensures only you can share or view your information. Easily integrate with cloud storage services like Google Drive, Dropbox, and OneDrive.

data.name: premiumproductkeyparagraph5
data.value: Encrypt both the content of your files and their names, including file extensions, for extra protection. This feature adds an additional layer of security to keep your files and their identities private.

data.name: premiumproductkeyparagraph6
data.value: Permanently delete files to ensure they cannot be recovered by unauthorized parties even with the most sophisticated tools.

data.name: premiumproductkeyparagraph7
data.value: Simplify your digital life with AxCrypt Premium's built-in password manager. Store, organize, and access all your passwords securely in one place, reducing the risk of weak or reused passwords. (Detail out- Credit Card, notes)

data.name: premiumproductkeyparagraph8
data.value: Our dedicated support team is available to assist with any questions or issues, ensuring that you can always make the most of AxCrypt Premium and keep your files secure.We will also guide you through easy-to-follow guides and tutorials to ensure you can make the most of our features.

data.name: PremiumProductKeyParagraph9
data.value: Enhance communication security with AES-256 encryption, ensuring messages remain private across web, desktop, and mobile. With Secured Messenger, only intended recipients can access messages, protecting sensitive information from unauthorized access.

data.name: PremiumRequiredBuyNowPopup
data.value: This feature requires a paid plan! Would you like us to open a web page where you can make a purchase?
data.comment: A popup with OK and Cancel buttons, telling the user that a paid plan is required, and asking if we should open a browser window where the user can make a purchase.

data.name: PremiumSecondBodyHeading
data.value: What happens after the trial?

data.name: PremiumSecondBodyText
data.value:
After 30 days, the trial turns into the subscription you signed up for, whether that’s monthly or yearly.

data.name: PrivacyPolicyBlock10Heading
data.value: Sharing information

data.name: PrivacyPolicyBlock10Text1
data.value: We may share your information: With the public if you submit content to one of our forums, such as blog comments, social media posting, or other features of our services that are publicly visible; with third parties such as other sites that integrate with our API or our Services; or those with an API or service that we integrate with; Any necessary third party engaged by us, including data processors, vendors, consultants, marketing partners, and other service providers who need access to such information to perform work on our behalf; In response to an information request by a competent authority if we believe disclosure is under or otherwise required by applicable law, regulation, license or legal process; if we otherwise notify you and you consent to the sharing; and in an aggregate and / or anonymous form which cannot be reasonably expected to be used to identify you.

data.name: PrivacyPolicyBlock11Heading
data.value: Social Media

data.name: PrivacyPolicyBlock11ListItem1
data.value: Google/YouTube:Privacy statement

data.name: PrivacyPolicyBlock11ListItem2
data.value: Twitter:Privacy statement

data.name: PrivacyPolicyBlock11ListItem3
data.value: Instagram:Privacy statement

data.name: PrivacyPolicyBlock11ListItem4
data.value: LinkedIn:Privacy statement

data.name: PrivacyPolicyBlock11ListItem5
data.value: Facebook:Privacy statement

data.name: PrivacyPolicyBlock11Text1
data.value: In addition to this website, we maintain social media sites on Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, YouTube and LinkedIn. If you visit one of these presences, personal data may be transmitted to the provider of the social network. We draw your attention to the fact that user data may be transferred to a server in a third-party country and may therefore be processed outside the European Union.

data.name: PrivacyPolicyBlock11Text2
data.value: In addition to the storage of the specific data you have entered in this social medium, further information may also be processed by the provider of the social network. If you are logged into the network with your personal user account while visiting the corresponding website, this network can assign the visit to this account. The purpose and scope of the data collection by the respective medium and the further processing of your data there, as well as your rights in this regard, can be found in the respective provisions of the respective person responsible, e.g. below:

data.name: PrivacyPolicyBlock12Heading
data.value: Transfer of data to third parties

data.name: PrivacyPolicyBlock12Text1
data.value: Customer Relationship Management (CRM) - Hubspot HubSpot is an integrated software solution with which we cover various aspects of our online marketing activities, among contact management via the CRM system. The legal basis for the use of the services of HubSpot is our rightful interest according to art. 6 I f GDPR due to the optimization of our marketing measures and the improvement of our service quality on the website.

data.name: PrivacyPolicyBlock12Text2
data.value: HubSpot meets the minimum requirements for legally compliant order data processing by concluding the European standard data protection clause. In addition, there is a Data Processing Agreement (DPA) with HubSpot. This ensures that HubSpot uses the user’s data only within the framework of EU data protection standards and does not pass them on to third parties. For more information, please refer to HubSpot’s data privacy policy.

data.name: PrivacyPolicyBlock13Heading
data.value: Changes to the Privacy Policy

data.name: PrivacyPolicyBlock14Heading
data.value: Governing law and venue

data.name: PrivacyPolicyBlock14Text1
data.value: This privacy statement is governed by Swedish law. Venue is Stockholm District Court.

data.name: PrivacyPolicyBlock1List1Item1
data.value: Your email address.

data.name: PrivacyPolicyBlock1List1Item2
data.value: Your operating system version, i.e. Windows Vista/2008/7/8/10/11 etc.

data.name: PrivacyPolicyBlock1List1Item3
data.value: Your selected language, i.e. English or French etc.

data.name: PrivacyPolicyBlock1List1Item4
data.value: The product version being installed.

data.name: PrivacyPolicyBlock1List2Item1
data.value: Your IP-address.

data.name: PrivacyPolicyBlock1List2Item2
data.value: The date and time.

data.name: PrivacyPolicyBlock1List2Item3
data.value: The URL accessed on our server.

data.name: PrivacyPolicyBlock1List3Item1
data.value: What type of emails we automatically send to you (activation, welcome etc).

data.name: PrivacyPolicyBlock1List3Item2
data.value: When an unexpected error (exception) occurs.

data.name: PrivacyPolicyBlock1Text1
data.value: Our privacy policy, of course, complies with the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR). In this privacy policy, we mention what we know about you, what we do with the information and why we need it. You can always withdraw your consent and request us to delete your data. Visit our dedicated GDPR page, to learn more about the regulation.

data.name: PrivacyPolicyBlock1Text2
data.value: When you sign up with us, you do agree that we may send you occasional emails such as newsletters, offers and information about new and updated products and services from us. You can opt out, i.e. unsubscribe, at any time by clicking the link provided for this in such emails.

data.name: PrivacyPolicyBlock1Text3
data.value: During the installation and sign up procedure AxCrypt may contact one of our servers, if you allow it, and send us some minimal information.

data.name: PrivacyPolicyBlock1Text4
data.value: This information is limited to:

data.name: PrivacyPolicyBlock1Text5
data.value: In addition to specific sign up information, when a device contacts a server of HTTP some information is always made available and we log this. This may include:

data.name: PrivacyPolicyBlock1Text6
data.value: We also log some additional specific events that are determined by the server access and internal procedures. This includes:

data.name: PrivacyPolicyBlock1Text7
data.value: All our servers are physically located in Sweden. We do not store any information created by the use of AxCrypt as described above anywhere else. For certain events, emails are generated, for example, non-delivery reports from your email provider or error logs. These emails may be sent to our staff who may be using commercial email service providers with international data centers.

data.name: PrivacyPolicyBlock2ListItem1
data.value: Address

data.name: PrivacyPolicyBlock2ListItem2
data.value: VAT number (for EU customers)

data.name: PrivacyPolicyBlock2Text1
data.value: When creating an AxCrypt Business subscription, we do ask some additional information. This may include:

data.name: PrivacyPolicyBlock2Text2
data.value: We use this information to make VAT deduction possible for EU companies, and to display on invoices. This information is also managed within a third party Customer Relationship Management (CRM) system.

data.name: PrivacyPolicyBlock3Heading
data.value: Why do we need this information?

data.name: PrivacyPolicyBlock3Text1
data.value: It’s obvious why we need some of the information. We try to keep the amount of information logged and stored to a minimum, and we store no personal or sensitive information except your email address. Any confidential information you store on our servers is encrypted with your password, which we do not store or know, except briefly during the server interaction.

data.name: PrivacyPolicyBlock3Text2
data.value: The other information is practical for us to see how and where AxCrypt is being used, so as to better prioritize development. It also to gives us a nice warm feeling seeing how much it’s being used!

data.name: PrivacyPolicyBlock3Text3
data.value: We also use the information logged to trace the events of usage when we receive and work with support requests. It has proven to be very helpful for us and improves the quality of support by for example seeing when last a successful sign in was made.

data.name: PrivacyPolicyBlock3Text4
data.value: Our privacy policy may be updated from time to time without prior notice. Please check here for the currently valid policy. If you do not accept the new changes, we may not be able to provide you with the services you request.

data.name: PrivacyPolicyBlock4Heading
data.value: Contact

data.name: PrivacyPolicyBlock4Text1
data.value: Should you have any specific questions about what we need a particular piece of information for, or if you want your data removed, please contact us at support@axcrypt.net

data.name: PrivacyPolicyBlock4Text2
data.value: If you are a Business users, and do not want to be included in our CRM system, please contact us at business@axcrypt.net

data.name: PrivacyPolicyBlock5Heading
data.value: Page and service functionality

data.name: PrivacyPolicyBlock5Text1
data.value: Cookies are used in the operation and presentation of data from websites. Such cookies may include language code information for the language selected by the user. It can be cookies with information that supports the load balancing of the system so that all users are guaranteed the best possible experience. For services that require login or search, cookies can be used that ensure that the service presents data to the right recipient.

data.name: PrivacyPolicyBlock6Heading
data.value: Web analytics and cookies

data.name: PrivacyPolicyBlock6Text1
data.value: As an important part of the work of creating a user-friendly website, we look at the user pattern of those who visit the site. We analyze user behaviour to make the user experience better. The purpose of using cookies is therefore to improve the customer experience. To analyze the information, we use the analysis tool Google Analytics. Google Analytics uses cookies/cookies (small text files that the site stores on the user's computer), which records the user's IP address, and provides information about each user's online movement. Examples of what the statistics give us answers to are; how many people visit different pages, how long the visit lasts, which sites the users come from and which browsers are used. None of the cookies allows us to associate information about your use of the site with you as an individual. Cookie data is automatically deleted 14 months after registration. You can do it yourself and manage the use of cookies by adjusting settings on your browser. The information collected by Google Analytics is stored on Google's servers in the United States. Information received is subject to Google guidelines for Privacy. An IP address is defined as personal information because it can be traced back to a particular hardware and thus to an individual. We anonymize the user's IP address before the information is stored and processed by Google. Thus, the anonymized IP address cannot be used to identify the individual user. Your IP address is also logged for a short period by our web servers. The user's IP-address, time of day, website address, HTTP status, number of bytes sent, HTTP referrer and HTTP user agent is logged for 15 days. Beyond this point, the data is deleted.

data.name: PrivacyPolicyBlock6Text2
data.value: If you understand, accept, and agree to the aforementioned policies, terms, and conditions outlined above, please click the Sign in button to proceed to your account. By proceeding, you acknowledge that your entered name will serve as your electronic signature to validate the consent. If you do not comprehend, accept, or agree to the aforementioned policies, terms, and conditions, then please do not click the Sign in button.

data.name: PrivacyPolicyBlock7Heading
data.value: Search

data.name: PrivacyPolicyBlock7Text1
data.value: We store information about which keywords users use on our sites through Google Analytics. The purpose of the storage is to make our information offer better. The usage pattern for search is stored in aggregate form. Only the keyword is stored, and they cannot be linked to other user information such as IP addresses.

data.name: PrivacyPolicyBlock8Heading
data.value: Forum / Share/tips-service

data.name: PrivacyPolicyBlock8Text1
data.value: The "Share with others'' features is voluntary and can be used to forward links to the site by email, or to share the content of social networking sites such as Facebook or Twitter. Information about tips is not logged with us but is only used there and then to post the tip of the social networking site. However, we cannot guarantee that the online community will not log this information. All such services should, therefore, be used wisely. You may contact the relevant service provider or online community to receive information about its collection, use, processing, and personal data protection. If you use the email feature, we only use the e-mail addresses given to forward the message without any form of storage.

data.name: PrivacyPolicyBlock9Heading
data.value: Newsletter

data.name: PrivacyPolicyBlock9Text1
data.value: When you sign up with us, you do agree that we may send you occasional emails such as newsletters, offers and information about new and updated products and services from us. In order for us to be able to send an email, you must register an email address. The legal basis for processing for this purpose is consent, cf. GDPR Article 6, paragraph 1, letter a. This information is not shared with other businesses and is deleted when we are told that you no longer wish to receive information from us. You can opt-out, i.e. unsubscribe, at any time by clicking the link provided for this in such emails. HubSpot is our data processor for the newsletter.

data.name: PrivacyPolicyDescription
data.value: We respect your privacy – that is one of the main reasons why we make AxCrypt. We also believe that you, as one of our users, are more concerned about this than the average computer user.

data.name: PrivacyPolicyLinkLabel
data.value: Privacy policy

data.name: PrivacyPolicyText
data.value: You agree to our Privacy Policy and Terms Of Use.

data.value: For PRIVATE users

data.name: ProductBadgesParagrapgh1
data.value: There is no single field that this software cannot fit. We have used it across all departments, and it works perfectly well.

data.name: ProductBadgesParagrapgh2
data.value: This software offers the confidentiality I needed for sensitive files containing my codes and programs. Encryption is advanced to professional levels which is a great idea for a secure and work environment.

data.name: ProductBadgesParagrapgh3
data.value: I like its strong focus on encryption, it gives us peace of mind that our data will be secure even in the event of unauthorized access. In addition, AxCrypt's ease of use is one of its greatest strengths.

data.name: ProductBadgesParagrapgh4
data.value: Has helped me secure company files automatically in google drive so that our files are stored on cloud, opening files by other Axcrypt users is possible as long as they have our password which makes it easy to share stored data within the organization when necessary.

data.name: ProductBusinessHeroText1
data.value: Easy to use and Reliable Encryption your Business Can Trust

data.name: ProductBusinessHeroText2
data.value: Centralized Key Management for Organisational Efficient operations

data.name: ProductBusinessHeroText3
data.value: Ensure Regulatory Compliance with Smoother Workflows

data.name: ProductBusinessHighlights1
data.value: Sharing files with the rest of the team is award winning easy with our cloud storage awareness and key sharing feature for on-premise files. This allows you to comply with data protection regulations while protecting your files from costly data breaches.

data.name: ProductBusinessHighlights2
data.value: With AxCrypt Business, you also have access to our Password Management – where you can store and manage passwords and codes securely. AxCrypt is multilingual, supporting Arabic, English, Dutch, French, German, Italian, Korean, Mandarin, Polish, Portuguese, Russian, Spanish, Swedish, Turkish and more to come. and more to follow. With the AxCrypt mobile app, you can encrypt and decrypt files on your phone, from anywhere and at any time.

data.name: ProductBusinessHighlights3
data.value: More exclusive Business Features coming soon. Don’t miss out!.

data.name: ProductBusinessHighlightsText1
data.value: With AxCrypt’s most-requested Group Feature, revolutionize the way your teams work and collaborate with your business data in a highly secure environment. This powerful feature allows you to create and manage teams within different groups, facilitating departmentalization of teams and establishing a clear hierarchical structure for secure and efficient data security operations. Easily assign different roles, manage group-specific Masterkey access, and ensure that sensitive information is protected and accessible only to authorized personnel.

data.name: ProductBusinessHighlightsText2
data.value: Enhance your team's efficiency with streamlined operations and advanced data protection. The Group Feature simplifies file and password sharing with entire groups at once, providing granular control over access and improving organizational efficiency. Transform your data management with AxCrypt’s innovative solutions designed to meet modern business needs.

data.name: ProductBusinessHightlightsTitle
data.value: AxCrypt now offers file security for companies and organisations – with 256-bit AES encryption.

data.name: ProductBusinessMasterKeySellingPointViews
data.value: The master key eliminates the risk of losing access to critical files.

data.name: ProductPagePremiumDescription2

data.name: ProductPasswordGeneratorText
data.value: Generate strong yet easy to remember passwords with AxCrypt’s Password Generator!

data.name: ProductPasswordManagerHighlights1
data.value: AxCrypt’s Password Manager is a secure, powerful, and user-friendly way to create and manage your passwords, card details, and notes. Generate strong and complex passwords for different sites and safeguard them with the AES-256 encryption algorithm.

data.name: ProductPasswordManagerHighlights2
data.value: AxCrypt’s Password Manager is available on web, iOS, and Android, and comes with offline access (iOS and Android). Details are synced to a secure cloud and can be accessed from any device.

data.name: ProductPasswordManagerHighlights3
data.value: AxCrypt is based in Sweden and fully complies with GDPR guidelines. All your data is encrypted using the AES-256 algorithm, and AxCrypt cannot see or access the user-generated data.

data.name: ProductPasswordManagerHighlights4
data.value: With the Share Secret feature, securely share sensitive passwords, card details, or notes with anyone with one click. Share with multiple people at the same time, set time restrictions for access to each shared item, and revoke access at any time.

data.name: ProductPasswordManagerHighlightsTitle
data.value: Secure Your Passwords, Cards, and Notes with AES-256. Access, Share and Sync from Any Device!

data.name: ProductPasswordManagerPricingHeading
data.value: Get Password Manager

data.name: ProductPremiumHeroText1

data.name: ProductPremiumHeroText2
data.value: Confidently Share Files with Family and Friends

data.name: ProductPremiumHeroText3
data.value: Access Encrypted Files Anywhere—Mobile, Local, or Cloud

data.name: ProductPremiumHightlights1
data.value: Encrypt your files with AES-256 – the strongest of the AES algorithm. It is used globally to protect sensitive and classified information of all levels. Securing folders has never been easier, only taking a single click to automatically secure new files.

data.name: ProductPremiumHightlights2
data.value: If you also need to share secured files with others, you will have key sharing to take care of that for you, even with access to cloud storage awareness in Dropbox, Google Drive and OneDrive, etc. With the AxCrypt mobile app, you can encrypt and decrypt files on your phone, from anywhere and at any time.

data.name: ProductPremiumHightlights3
data.value: Want to save password in a safe and easy way? Use our password management and generator to keep all your passwords safe in the cloud.

data.name: ProductPremiumHightlightsTitle
data.value: With AxCrypt Premium, you have access to extended functionality and exciting features!

data.name: RegulatoryComplianceBlock1Heading
data.value: How can AxCrypt help with the GDPR?

data.name: RegulatoryComplianceBlock1Text1
data.value: The EU General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) is a binding legislative act concerning the protection of personal data and individual rights. It was designed to harmonize data privacy laws across Europe, to protect and empower all EU citizens data privacy, and to reshape the way organizations approach data privacy.

data.name: RegulatoryComplianceBlock1Text2
data.value: The GDPR requires companies and organizations to implement reasonable ways to protect their data, such as encryption, to protect it against data loss or exposure. This is where AxCrypt can help.

data.name: RegulatoryComplianceBlock1Text3
data.value: As Recital 83 in the GDPR states: ”In order to maintain security and to prevent processing in infringement of this Regulation, the controller or processor should evaluate the risks inherent in the processing and implement measures to mitigate those risks, such as encryption.”

data.name: RegulatoryComplianceBlock1Text4
data.value: You have to make sure that personal data is stored securely, whether on-premise or cloud-based, in order to prevent costly data breaches. Files that have been encrypted will be rendered useless when breached.

data.name: RegulatoryComplianceBlock1Text5
data.value: Below are some resources that can further inform you.

data.name: RegulatoryComplianceBlock2Heading
data.value: Is AxCrypt HIPAA compliant?

data.name: RegulatoryComplianceBlock2ListItem1
data.value: Access Control/Encryption and Decryption – AES-128/AES-256

data.name: RegulatoryComplianceBlock2ListItem2
data.value: Integrity/Authentication – HMAC-SHA-512 Transmission

data.name: RegulatoryComplianceBlock2ListItem3
data.value: Security/Integrity Controls, Encryption AES-128/AES-256/HMAC-SHA-512

data.name: RegulatoryComplianceBlock2Text1
data.value: The Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act protects the privacy and security of health information. Compliance of HIPAA only applies to organizations and processes. It does not apply to software, meaning that an encryption solution such as AxCrypt can’t be HIPAA compliant. Although, AxCrypt may suffice as (part of) a Technical Safeguard.

data.name: RegulatoryComplianceBlock2Text2
data.value: The appropriate use of encryption and other Technical Safeguards is governed by the HIPAA Security Standards, 45 CFR 160, 162 and 164. The relevant section is 164.312 Technical Safeguards. No recommendations or requirements concerning specific encryption technologies are made there either, it’s specifically pointed out that the regulation is technology-neutral. It’s up to each and every organization to evaluate its position and risks, and then implement required or addressable specifications.

data.name: RegulatoryComplianceBlock2Text3
data.value: You have to make sure that personal data is stored securely, whether on-premise or cloud-based, in order to prevent costly data breaches. Files that have been encrypted will be rendered useless when breached.

data.name: RegulatoryComplianceBlock2Text4
data.value: Although the standard in no way refers to it except in comments, the CMS Internet Security Policy, which is the current view of Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services for their own use, does specify some minimal technology levels for certain cases. AxCrypt meets these requirements for transmission over the Internet – but your organization must independently evaluate if is sufficient to use the same level as the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services.

data.name: RegulatoryComplianceBlock2Text5
data.value: The parts where AxCrypt may (and should) suffice as (part of) a Technical Safeguard are:

data.name: RegulatoryComplianceBlock2Text6
data.value: The HIPAA Security Standard does allow the use of encryption as the basis for Access Control, that is to say to protect the privacy of data at rest (stored on a hard disk as opposed to traversing the Internet for example). AxCrypt will meet most organizations requirements here too.

data.value: Regulatory Compliance

data.name: RequirementsLinkLabel

data.name: RequirementsLinuxText
data.value: Other users have reported success running AxCrypt under Wine. However, it may be tricky to install since it requires dependencies to be manually installed, and the state of Mono (on which it depends) is very varying depending on the distribution.

data.name: RequirementsNoteText
data.value: AxCrypt runs on 32-bit and 64-bit versions of Windows. On Windows 8 and 10, AxCrypt works in desktop mode, but there is no Metro app available yet, nor does AxCrypt run on Windows RT. We recommend to user desktop viewers and editors to open files secured with AxCrypt, as the Metro apps sometimes cause various issues.

data.value: AxCrypt is currently available on most major platforms. The table below shows all supported operating systems.

data.name: ResellerBenefitsText
data.value: AxCrypt has customers from all over the world, relying on the simplicity and safety of our encryption tool. Our biggest markets includes US, UK and France. AxCrypt is expanding more and more every day, and we want you to grow along.

data.name: ResellerBenefitsText1
data.value: Offer AxCrypt's encryption solutions directly to businesses, expanding your reach in the B2B market.

data.name: ResellerBenefitsText2
data.value: Handle the setup and ongoing management of AxCrypt accounts for your clients, ensuring seamless service.

data.name: ResellerBenefitsText3
data.value: Determine your own profit margins on sales, giving you control over your earnings.

data.name: ResellerBenefitsText4
data.value: Increase your revenue with progressive earnings as you grow your client base and sales volume.

data.name: ResellerBenefitsText5
data.value: Enjoy personalized support and guidance from a dedicated Account Manager to help you succeed as a reseller.

data.name: ResellerCyberSecurityHeading
data.value: Create a sustained income stream while promoting Cyber Security Practices for yourself and your clients

data.name: ResellerGeneratingRevenueHeading

data.name: ResellerHelpAddAndManageCustomersBlock1ListItem1
data.value: Log in to account.axcrypt.net

data.name: ResellerHelpAddAndManageCustomersBlock1ListItem3
data.value: On the creation page, enter your customer’s information and the number of licenses needed. This can be changed later if needed.

data.name: ResellerHelpAddAndManageCustomersBlock1ListItem4
data.value: Select whether you want a monthly or yearly subscription by choosing 1 or 12 months.

data.name: ResellerHelpAddAndManageCustomersBlock1ListItem5
data.value: For VAT deduction (within the EU), enter a valid VAT number.

data.name: ResellerHelpAddAndManageCustomersBlock1ListItem6
data.value: The reseller’s discount will be automatically added.

data.name: ResellerHelpAddAndManageCustomersBlock1ListItem7
data.value: Click the payment button.

data.name: ResellerHelpAddAndManageCustomersBlock1ListItem9
data.value: Finally, you can add the email addresses of the users that need to be assigned a license.

data.name: ResellerHelpAddAndManageCustomersBlock1Text1
data.value: To resell AxCrypt Business to a new customer, create their subscription on the account website:

data.name: ResellerHelpAddAndManageCustomersBlock1Text2
data.value:
Note: It will work both if your customer does or does not have a registered AxCrypt account.
They will receive an email or invite saying they have been added to a Business subscription. They must then activate their account.

data.name: ResellerHelpAddAndManageCustomersBlock1Text3
data.value:
You will automatically be added to their subscription as an administrator of their account.
Naturally, you will not be assigned a license.

data.name: ResellerHelpAddAndManageCustomersBlock1Text4
data.value: If you make any of your customer’s users an administrator, they will be able to purchase new licenses and manage the account. This means that you and they will not get the discount. We suggest not making them an administrator unless really needed.

data.name: ResellerHelpAddAndManageCustomersBlock1Text5
data.value: If any information has been filled in incorrectly during the creation, you can always change it by going to .

data.name: ResellerHelpAddAndManageCustomersBlock1Text6
data.value: This process is designed so it is completely managed by you and does not require any involvement from your customer (besides activating the account, should they not have an existing account yet), or from AxCrypt. If payment by bank transfer is preferred, this is possible too. See the billing tab for more information.

data.name: ResellerHelpAddAndManageCustomersBlock1Text7
data.value: AxCrypt offers one subscription for reselling: AxCrypt Business. You can use the sub menus on account.axcrypt.net to manage your existing clients or purchase licenses for your clients. Log in using the existing account that has been set as the admin.

data.name: ResellerHelpAddAndManageCustomersBlock1Text8
data.value: To contact the Reselling team, email us at reseller@axcrypt.net.

data.name: ResellerHelpAddAndManageCustomersBlock2ListItem1
data.value: Choose your customer from the Acting On drop down menu.

data.name: ResellerHelpAddAndManageCustomersBlock2ListItem2
data.value: Add users individually by their email address.

data.name: ResellerHelpAddAndManageCustomersBlock2Text1
data.value: You can add users to the customer’s account. Just be sure that unused licenses are available — the administrator can add users as long as there are licenses available.

data.name: ResellerHelpAddAndManageCustomersBlock2Text2
data.value: To add users:

data.name: ResellerHelpAddAndManageCustomersBlock3ListItem1
data.value: Choose the number of licenses needed.

data.name: ResellerHelpAddAndManageCustomersBlock3Text1
data.value: If your customer’s account has all their licenses in use, you can purchase additional licenses:

data.name: ResellerHelpAddAndManageCustomersBlock3Text2
data.value:
Note: If a payment by bank transfer is preferred, this is possible too. See billing down below for more information.
When a subscription is created or renewed, the period is always a year.

data.name: ResellerHelpAddAndManageCustomersBlock3Text3
data.value: When additional members licenses are purchased for a subscription within the subscription period, only the remaining months rounded upwards to whole months are charged for. If 50 days remain for the current period, and additional members are added, this will be for 2 months/additional member.

data.name: ResellerHelpAddAndManageCustomersBlock4ListItem1
data.value: You now have an unused license. You can either save it for when you need it (this doesn’t pause the expiration date) or assign it to a new user.

data.name: ResellerHelpAddAndManageCustomersBlock4Text1
data.value: Removing or changing users in your customer’s account are simple:

data.name: ResellerHelpAddAndManageCustomersSubTitle1
data.value: Add a new customer

data.name: ResellerHelpAddAndManageCustomersSubTitle2
data.value: Add users to a customer’s account

data.name: ResellerHelpAddAndManageCustomersSubTitle3
data.value: Purchase additional member licenses

data.name: ResellerHelpAddAndManageCustomersSubTitle4
data.value: Removing or changing users

data.name: ResellerHelpAddAndManageCustomersTitle
data.value: Add and manage customers

data.name: ResellerHelpBillingBlock1Text1
data.value: Subscriptions are purchased through AxCrypt web account portal (account.axcrypt.net). The payments are made directly through the portal with a credit card.

data.name: ResellerHelpBillingBlock1Text2
data.value: It may also be possible for you to purchase by invoice, usually dependant on the number of subscriptions you wish to purchase. If you would like to do so, contact the Reselling team. If payment is done via bank transfer, it may take longer for your customer to get access, as we first have to receive the payment.

data.name: ResellerHelpBillingBlock2Text1
data.value: The current list price per member license for AxCrypt Business can be found on our pricing page. You have a personal Reseller’s discount which applies to this.

data.name: ResellerHelpBillingBlock2Text2
data.value: For the purposes of a subscription a month is defined as 30 days and a year as 360 days. When a subscription is created or renewed, the period is always a month or a year.

data.name: ResellerHelpBillingBlock2Text3
data.value: When additional members licenses are purchased for a subscription within the subscription period, only the remaining months rounded upwards to whole months are charged for. If 50 days remain for the current period, and additional members are added, this will be for 2 months/additional member.

data.name: ResellerHelpBillingBlock2Text4
data.value: Read “Payment and Renewal” in our Terms of Use for more information.

data.name: ResellerHelpBillingBlock3Text1
data.value: Since June 25th 2020, we automatically renew subscriptions. If you purchased licenses before then, neither you nor your client will be charged automatically. You’ll have to renew via the menu.

data.name: ResellerHelpBillingBlock3Text2
data.value: If you purchased licenses after June 25th 2020, the subscription will automatically renew at the end of the subscription period, using the initial payment method. If you want to cancel, you must do so before the end of the current subscription period.

data.name: ResellerHelpBillingBlock3Text3
data.value: Read “Payment and Renewal” in our Terms of Use for more information.

data.name: ResellerHelpBillingBlock4ListItem2
data.value: Here you will find your invoices and transaction history.

data.name: ResellerHelpBillingBlock4ListItem4
data.value: Information such as date, reference, address, etc.

data.name: ResellerHelpBillingBlock4ListItem5
data.value: Paid for which customer.

data.name: ResellerHelpBillingBlock4ListItem6
data.value: Subscription ordered.

data.name: ResellerHelpBillingBlock4ListItem7
data.value: Total amount.

data.name: ResellerHelpBillingBlock4ListItem8
data.value: You can print the invoice by clicking the print icon.

data.name: ResellerHelpBillingBlock5Text1
data.value: EU VAT will be deducted before purchasing when entering a valid VAT number. VAT is not applicable for countries outside EU.

data.name: ResellerHelpBillingBlock5Text2
data.value: For Swedish customers, VAT deduction is not possible. As AxCrypt is a Swedish company, Swedish customers will have to have to book the incoming VAT as incoming, and this is then deducted from outgoing VAT when they pay to Swedish Tax authorities.

data.name: ResellerHelpBillingBlock5Text3
data.value: Note: AxCrypt can’t further advise you on tax matters. Please check your country’s regulations or contact your tax advisor for more details.

data.name: ResellerHelpSupportBlock1Text1
data.value: Our resellers (and their customers) can of course rely on professional technical support from AxCrypt. Online we have lots of documentation and product information:

data.name: ResellerHelpSupportBlock1Text2
data.value: Furthermore, technical support is available at support@axcrypt.net. Their time zone is UTC+5:30, and usually respond during office hours within a day.

data.name: ResellerHelpSupportBlock1Text3
data.value: Of course, we always suggest that our Resellers have used AxCrypt themselves before, so that they can help their customers with some basic technical questions. Otherwise we also have a bunch of tutorials that explain various features of AxCrypt. They are available on our YouTube Channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCoSoXBjq6iCG5232fHoWStA

data.name: ResellerHelpSupportBlock1Text4

data.name: ResellerHelpSupportBlock2Text1
data.value: As a Reseller, you are responsible for your own sales and how you approach your (potential) customer. But, of course, we would like to assist you with your sales. Teamwork makes the dream work!

data.name: ResellerHelpSupportBlock2Text2
data.value: For advertisement purposes, and to show to your customers, we have created a presentation and brochure of AxCrypt. It will explain what AxCrypt is and how it can help you to keep your data protected.

data.value: Reseller Information

data.name: ResellerInfoText1
data.value: AxCrypt offers an easy-to-use encryption solution. With over 15 years of experience in the file encryption industry, we have established AxCrypt as one of the strongest brands out there. With over 20 million downloads, we have proven that our service is reliable. AxCrypt has been awarded with PCMag’s Editors’ Choice for Best Encryption Software in 2016, 2017, 2018, 2019, 2020 and 2021.

data.name: ResellerInfoText2
data.value: As a Reseller, you will be able to sell AxCrypt Business (currently not supporting reseller programs for AxCrypt Premium). For a small price, Business members get access to a lot more features and additional support, including; AES-256 bit encryption, Mobile Apps, File Sharing, Cloud Storage Awareness, Password Management, and the ability to manage accounts.

data.name: ResellerInfoText3
data.value: Our mission is to provide teams with encryption solutions that are easier to use than ever before, and you can be a part of it! Please apply by filling out the form by clicking the button below, or contacting us at reseller@axcrypt.net.

data.name: SecurityBlock1Heading
data.value: Why is AxCrypt secure?

data.name: SecurityBlock1Text
data.value: AxCrypt is secure because it endeavors to only use accepted practices and algorithms and does not attempt to invent any new encryption algorithms or methods. It’s also open source; Anyone may inspect the source code, check it for errors, omissions or back doors. It has been used and inspected for vulnerabilities for over 15 years and tried by more than 30 million users, without any known weaknesses.

data.name: SecurityBlock2Heading
data.value: How secure is AxCrypt?

data.name: SecurityBlock2Text
data.value: This question breaks down to effective encryption key lengths. The key length used is 128 or 256 bits – exhaustive search is not currently believed to be an option in either case and it is computationally infeasible in cryptographic terms. The problem lies with the passwords used – this is the weak point. You can read more about what to consider when choosing a password below.

data.name: SecurityBlock3Heading
data.value: Password considerations

data.name: SecurityBlock3ListItem1
data.value: The name of the file, as well as the size, may be recovered.

data.name: SecurityBlock3ListItem2
data.value: If the file has been viewed or edited with an application that creates temporary copies of the content (such as Microsoft Office), those temporary copies may still be available for undeletion on your hard disk.

data.name: SecurityBlock3Text1
data.value: AxCrypt uses AES-128 or AES-256 in the Premium version – but if you want to achieve that level of security you must give it 128 or 256 bits of truly ‘random’ data. This is very hard to do, but the easiest way to even approach this is to use the password generator included in Premium.

data.name: SecurityBlock3Text2
data.value: To actually get 128 or 256 bits, you’ll in practice have to save this password in a text file, and then keep that text file very secret.Using typical English language in a password, 128 bits is approximately equivalent to 10 ‘random’ words, and 256 bits thus twice this. Do not use meaningful sentences and absolutely not famous or even obscure quotations!By introducing variations on the case, as well as non-alphabetic characters you can reduce the number of words necessary. It’s not recommended to use less than 5 words. If you use a completely random selection of upper and lower-case letters and digits, you need 22 characters to achieve 128 bits security, and thus 44 characters for 256 bits. (The above is a slight simplification of the issue, but it should serve.)The shredding, or wiping, feature of AxCrypt allows you to erase files in a way that makes it impossible to recover the contents with undeletion software. However, there are some caveats:

data.name: SecurityBlock3Text3
data.value: See the section on local PC security for tips on how to increase your security margin for these matters.

data.name: SecurityBlock4Heading
data.value: Local PC Security

data.name: SecurityBlock4List1Item1
data.value: Your applications maintaining clear text in memory, which subsequently is placed in the paging file.

data.name: SecurityBlock4List1Item2
data.value: Your applications creating temporary files, which are not properly wiped.

data.name: SecurityBlock4List1Item3
data.value: Deep reading of overwritten hard-disk data with custom software and laboratory equipment.

data.name: SecurityBlock4List2Item1
data.value: Untimely power cycling of your computer and subsequent cryptanalysis.

data.name: SecurityBlock4List2Item2
data.value: Keyboard-sniffers, either in hardware or software.

data.name: SecurityBlock4List3Item1
data.value: Strong passwords, either with AxCrypt or your sign in.

data.name: SecurityBlock4List3Item2
data.value: Password-protected screen savers.

data.name: SecurityBlock4Text1
data.value: AxCrypt by itself will not protect your local PC from, for example:

data.name: SecurityBlock4Text2
data.value: Data exposure due to:

data.name: SecurityBlock4Text3
data.value: Password exposure due to:

data.name: SecurityBlock4Text4
data.value: Neglect to use:

data.name: SecurityBlock5Heading
data.value: Account Keys

data.name: SecurityBlock5Text1
data.value: An account key is what enables the implementation of various new rich features, such as allowing other team members to open secured files with their own passwords. In technical terms, an AxCrypt Account key consists of a public key pair composed of a public (non-secret) and a private (secret) part and some other meta data.

data.name: SecurityBlock5Text2
data.value: The account key is always kept secured with your password as well, although one part of it is not secret and is used when securing files for you and your team. For you, the benefit is that you can change the password for all files in one single operation. For your team members, the benefit is that you and your team can allow each other to open secured files without sharing passwords by just specifying the email address of the other member.

data.name: SecurityBlock5Text3
data.value: Anyone can use your email address to allow you to open a secured file with your own passphrase, and you can allow anyone with an email address to open a file secured by you. All this is enabled by the public part of the account key being available on our server.

data.name: SecurityBlock6Heading
data.value: Algorithms

data.name: SecurityBlock6Text1
data.value: The cryptological primitives are AES-128 or AES-256 for bulk encryption, PBKDF2 with HMAC-512 for key deriviation, 4096-bit RSA for the account key, and HMAC-512 for integrity checking.

data.name: SecurityBlock6Text2
data.value: The algorithms used are deemed secure as such, to the best of our knowledge, by the US Government and the Internet community. Please see the documents package and the source code for details.

data.name: SecurityBlock6Text3
data.value: Key wrapping of the password is done using the NIST specification for AES Key Wrap. The key derived from the password with PBKDF2-SHA512 is only used as a key encrypting key.

data.name: SecurityBlock6Text4
data.value: As a brute force counter measure, key wrapping is done with at least 5 000 iterations, increasing the work effort with approximately 12 bits. The actual iteration count is determined dynamically, a typical value is 25 000 to 100 000, adding 14-17 bits of effective key-length. The faster machine you install AxCrypt on – the better the security!

data.name: SecurityBlock6Text5
data.value: AxCrypt uses the Advanced Encryption Standard with 128-bit or 256-bit keys in Counter mode with a ‘random’ IV for the data encryption.

data.name: SecurityBlock6Text6
data.value: For integrity verification AxCrypt uses HMAC-SHA512, i.e. Hash Message Authentication Code using SHA-512 with 512-bit output.

data.name: SecurityBlock6Text7
data.value: The pseudo random number generator (PRNG) used is primarily the operating system provided one, in some cases with added entropy added.

data.name: SecurityBlock6Text8
data.value: There may well be bugs in our implementation though – that is why it’s open source, so you and our peers may review it and keep it safe. This should not be taken as a low level of confidence in our code – anyone who tells you their code is flawless is either inexperienced or lying.

data.name: SecurityBlock7Heading
data.value: Is AxCrypt HIPAA compliant?

data.name: SecurityBlock7ListItem1
data.value: Access Control/Encryption and Decryption – AES-128/AES-256

data.name: SecurityBlock7ListItem2
data.value: Integrity/Authentication – HMAC-SHA-512 Transmission

data.name: SecurityBlock7ListItem3
data.value: Security/Integrity Controls, Encryption AES-128/AES-256/HMAC-SHA-512

data.name: SecurityBlock7Text1
data.value: There is no such thing as HIPAA compliant software. Only organizations and procedures can be HIPAA compliant.

data.name: SecurityBlock7Text2
data.value: The appropriate use of encryption and other Technical Safeguards is governed by the HIPAA Security Standards, 45 CFR 160, 162 and 164. The relevant section is 164.312 Technical Safeguards. No recommendations or requirements concerning specific encryption technologies are made there either, it’s specifically pointed out that the regulation is technology-neutral. It’s up to each and every organization to evaluate its position and risks, and then implement required or addressable specifications.

data.name: SecurityBlock7Text3
data.value: Although the standard in no way refers to it except in comments, the CMS Internet Security Policy, which is the current view of Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services for their own use, does specify some minimal technology levels for certain cases. AxCrypt meets these requirements for transmission over the Internet – but your organization must independently evaluate if is sufficient to use the same level as the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services.

data.name: SecurityBlock7Text4
data.value: The parts where AxCrypt may (and should) suffice as (part of) a Technical Safeguard are:

data.name: SecurityBlock7Text5
data.value: The HIPAA Security Standard does allow the use of encryption as the basis for Access Control, that is to say to protect the privacy of data at rest (stored on a hard disk as opposed to traversing the Internet for example). AxCrypt will meet most organizations requirements here too.

data.name: SecurityDescriptionText
data.value: In order to achieve good security, it’s beneficial to understand a little bit about how to best use AxCrypt with passwords and local PC security. There are also some details on the algorithms and methods used in AxCrypt below.

data.name: StudentCommunityText
data.value:
Protect your studies and personal data with . Don’t miss out on this exclusive offer—sign up now and secure your files!

If you have any questions or need further assistance, feel free to reach out to our support team at support@axcrypt.net.

data.name: StudentDiscountparagraph
data.value: Take advantage of our 30-day free trial and enjoy a 50% discount on AxCrypt Premium. Start protecting your academic work today! To claim your 50% discount, please complete the following steps:

data.name: StudentDiscountParagraph1
data.value: Submit your details using the form

data.name: StudentDiscountParagraph2
data.value: After you submit the form, our team will manually verify your student ID and information.

data.name: StudentDiscountParagraph3
data.value: You will receive a confirmation email once your status is verified and the discount is activated.
